lorebooks.name: Episode 1
lorebooks.description:
An alien race known as the Sirens descended upon the world and drove humanity out of the seas with their advanced technology. In order to counter them, humanity created a global alliance known as Azur Lane. It was composed of the four great factions ‚Äì Eagle Union, Royal Navy, Iron Blood, and Sakura Empire. After a long and hard-fought battle, they were able to finally drive away the Sirens. Time passed‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶which leads us to the present! It seems forces from Eagle Union and Royal Navy are gathering at a newly constructed Azur Lane base. Light Cruiser Cleveland and Battleship Prince of Wales are at the dock to greet their comrades Aircraft Carrier Illustrious and Light Aircraft Carrier Unicorn. They head over to the Azur Lane Academy where they discuss how to handle Iron Blood and Sakura Empire. It seems there is some dissonance between the camps and the Iron Blood/Sakura Empire combo is planning hostilities. That doesn‚Äôt sound too good at all! Elsewhere, Unicorn is searching for her lost friend U-chan‚Ä¶who is an actual baby unicorn, I think. Luckily for her, other shipgirls such as Destroyer Javelin and Destroyer Laffey are willing to help her with the search. As they proceed to look all over for U-chan, we‚Äôre introduced to a lot of other shipgirls. Like, a lot. I can‚Äôt keep up, there‚Äôs just so many of them! Eventually, they come across a shipgirl who has found Unicorn‚Äôs friend! She hands U-chan over and they all thank her. Before they can even really start up a conversation, she disappears. Also, it looks like the base is under attack!?!?

Turns out the vanishing shipgirl, Ayanami, is actually their enemy. SHOCKING TRUTH! She makes contact with her allies Aircraft Carrier Akagi and Aircraft Carrier Kaga, who seem to be VERY close, and feeds them information about the base. They‚Äôre ready for a fight. Looks like we got some action coming up! Sirens are attacking the base and all of the available shipgirls gather at the docks and begin transforming into battle mode. I must say that some of the transformation sequences, such as Cleveland‚Äôs, were absolutely stunning. The Azur Lane shipgirls take care of business and defeat the Sirens. However, they were never the real threat in this particular altercation. We learn that a difference in ideals had divided the four factions. Eagle Union and Royal Navy restrict themselves to using powers only created by humankind. On the other hand, Iron Blood and Sakura Empire are willing to use Siren technology to defeat the aliens. This difference of opinions has led to this seemingly silly war between Azur Lane (Eagle Union and Royal Navy) and Red Axis (Iron Blood and Sakura Empire).

What follows is a lot of mighty fine action! The Azur Lane shipgirls are now struggling against the Red Axis attacks. In one of the coolest scenes in the entire episode, Kaga summons a gigantic fox aircraft carrier that I can only describe as badass. It‚Äôs all Iron Blood/Sakura Empire at this point and it seems they‚Äôve got victory in the bag‚Ä¶or so they thought. Making her grandiose entrance to this battle is none other than the strongest Eagle Union aircraft carrier, the Grey Ghost, Enterprise! She quickly transforms into battle mode and engages with Kaga. The highlight of this episode, in my opinion, was definitely the Enterprise versus Kaga fight. Although brief, it was nothing short of amazing and a real treat for the eyes. Enterprise takes Kaga down and all the shipgirls can‚Äôt help but be awestruck by her overwhelming strength. Red Axis decides it‚Äôs the perfect time for a strategic retreat and bail, but assure Azur Lane that this isn‚Äôt over. Not bad, not bad at all.
lorebooks.creator: Exnos

1.content:
After the battle from the previous episode, it‚Äôs no surprise that the Azur Lane base is a complete mess. Some cute looking duck things are going around fishing injured shipgirls out of the water. It‚Äôs exactly as adorable as it sounds. Prince of Wales and Illustrious are discussing the battle and making preparations for the next one that will inevitably follow. They also acknowledge that they were victorious only because of Enterprise. Prince of Wales praises her relentless strength while Illustrious calls her unsafe. Speaking of Enterprise, the battle has taken a lot out of her and needs rest. Cleveland urges her to do so but she refuses, warning her that they can‚Äôt lower their guard while their enemy is still close.

What follows next are a few moments of cute shipgirls doing cute things. Nothing wrong with that. I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôs why some of us are here in the first place. However, there were also a few moments of cute shipgirls doing‚Ä¶sexy things!? You read that right. There‚Äôs a scene where a sleepy Laffey accidentally pulls down Javelin‚Äôs shirt, much to her chagrin. Laffey is in the same boat though as her top also slips off. This isn‚Äôt surprising at all since her top is always so darn loose. Some naughty crab crawls onto her exposed chest but before it can cause some mischief, Javelin yanks it off and pulls up Laffey‚Äôs shirt. I never knew crabs were such perverts. So yeah, unexpected shipgirl fanservice. I‚Äôm sure a lot of fans out there appreciated that.

And you know what? There‚Äôs still a little more. Elsewhere, Akagi and Kaga are having some very sensual sisterly bonding. Akagi sure loves touching Kaga, a lot. She also likes licking her. They‚Äôre soon joined by Heavy Cruiser Prinz Eugen. They discuss a few things and recognize that Enterprise is going to be trouble for them. They can‚Äôt afford to underestimate her. A notification arrives and informs them that there‚Äôs a detached force nearby. Naturally, they decide to have a little fun for them.

I would like to highlight two conversations that happen next. Ayanami and Destroy Z23 are conversing about their mission. Ayanami doesn‚Äôt dislike fighting, nor does she particularly enjoy it. She asks Z23 if she enjoys fighting. Z23 shrugs the question off and states that what they like is irrelevant. Their duty is to execute the mission. Nothing less, nothing more. Back at the Azur Lane base, Javelin and Laffey are having a picnic. A few moments later, they are joined by Enterprise. She still doesn‚Äôt appear to be in great shape. Javelin asks her why she pushes herself so hard? Enterprise laughs off the question and remarks that the purpose of their existence is to fight. That right there is probably my biggest gripe with the show. They‚Äôre fighting just for the sake of fighting. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love the fights. But I feel like they lack some substance, you know?

Speaking of fights, it‚Äôs about time for one! That previously mentioned nearby Azur Lane detached force includes Heavy Cruiser Northampton, Destroyer Hammann, Light Cruiser Helena, Light Aircraft Carrier Long Island, Battleship Arizona, and Aircraft Carrier Hornet. Oh my goodness, so many shipgirls! More names that I‚Äôll have to try and remember. By the way, Hornet is Enterprise‚Äôs younger sister. They‚Äôre attacked by the Red Axis sister pair of Aircraft Carrier Shoukaku and Aircraft Carrier Zuikaku. Being notified of the attack, Enterprise immediately sorties despite not being a hundred percent. Her sister is in trouble after all! Cleveland, Javelin, and Laffey tag along too. When they arrive at the battlefield, they discover that all the shipgirls there have been defeated except for Hornet. She‚Äôs barely able to hold her own against Zuikaku. Enterprise interjects in their fight and takes over for her sister.

While Enterprise and Zuikaku trade blows, Battleship Queen Elizabeth and her noble fleet of the Royal Navy arrive. In true English fashion, she‚Äôs having tea served by her shipgirl maids. I don‚Äôt know why this amused me so much, but it did. Anyways, Enterprise and Zuikaku are having an amazing fight. I‚Äôm glad the quality of the action hasn‚Äôt diminished at all. Enterprise eventually overpowers her foe and attempts to finish her off. However, her bow snaps in half before she can fire off the finishing shot. Knowing that this is her best chance, Zuikaku powers up her katana and charges at Enterprise. Enterprise attempts one last attack but to no avail. Fortunately for her, one of Queen Elizabeth‚Äôs maids blocks the attack for her in the nick of time. Sadly, we‚Äôll have to see the conclusion of this fight in the next episode.

2.content:
Enterprise was in a tough spot at the end of the last episode. Her bow snapped in half and she was utterly defenseless. Zuikaku was about to land the finishing blow on her but she was intercepted by one of Queen Elizabeth‚Äôs maid, Light Cruiser Belfast. Prinz Eugen warns her fellow Red Axis shipgirls to not underestimate Belfast. She may look like a fool but she‚Äôs actually a legendary fighter! It seems these two have a bit of history. Prinz Eugen would love to settle their old score but she notices Queen Elizabeth‚Äôs forces consisting of Battleship Warspite, Battleship Hood, Light Cruiser Edinburgh, and Light Cruiser Sheffield closing in on them. She suggests that Red Axis should retreat for now and they do. Enterprise immediately passes out after they leave.

She awakens sometime later in a room and is told what happened by Belfast. Enterprise thanks Belfast for protecting her and quickly leaves without taking any rest. I‚Äôm starting to realize that Enterprise is quite the stubborn shipgirl. Just get some rest already! Heck, she won‚Äôt even eat breakfast when offered and instead opts to eat some ration bars. Quite stubborn indeed. Prince of Wales and Illustrious continue their conversation from last week. Prince of Wales once again praises Enterprise‚Äôs strength while Illustrious still believes that she‚Äôs a loose cannon. She also doesn‚Äôt want to see her get grounded during the upcoming battles. They decide to discuss this further with Queen Elizabeth. She doesn‚Äôt feel that this matter involves her but they convince her that Enterprise is a key component for their victory. Queen Elizabeth tasks Belfast with determining what type of ship she really is.

Belfast finds Enterprise walking around the base and tells her that Unicorn wishes to see her. Elsewhere, some of the shipgirls decide to go to the beach and have some fun. Shipgirls in their swimsuits doing cute things at the beach? I can already sense the excitement from a lot of you. Keep yourselves together! Anyways, the shipgirls are all having a good time. Well, everyone except for San Diego. She almost got eaten by a shark. She sure finds herself in a lot of unfortunate situations. Meanwhile, Enterprise‚Äôs group finds their way to the beach with the other shipgirls. Enterprise sits in the sand and watches Unicorn as she plays in the water. What did Unicorn want to talk about? She just wanted to thank Enterprise for saving her! D‚Äôawww. However, Enterprise shrugs off the praise and states that she was just simply doing her job. Come on Enterprise, read the mood a little! Unicorn looks out at the ocean and comments how beautiful it looks right now. Enterprise scoffs that everyone says the same thing. She has never felt that the ocean is beautiful. Why would she? All she does is fight on the ocean. It only reminds her of a battlefield and there is no beauty in that. Wow, tell us how you really feel! Though I must admit that I do appreciate seeing Enterprise revealing some of her true feelings. A little bit of character development is always a good thing. Unicorn then poses a question to Enterprise ‚Äì is she afraid of the ocean? Enterprise doesn‚Äôt have an answer to that question. Interesting, very interesting.

Day turns to night and it starts raining. Enterprise seems to be lost in thought and Belfast brings over an umbrella for her. She then bluntly asks her how long does she plan to keep on fighting recklessly? Why does she have no regard for her own wellbeing? In Belfast‚Äôs eyes, it looks like Enterprise is actually tired of fighting. She also adds that Enterprise‚Äôs way of life is flawed and that someday she will lead herself to ruin. Dang, Belfast speaking the harsh truth! I love it. Enterprise definitely needed to hear all of that. I‚Äôm starting to become a big fan of Belfast.

A distress call is sent to the base and a few shipgirls are dispatched. Enterprise decides to join them even though she‚Äôs in no shape to fight. Did she not learn anything!? Belfast once again criticizes her recklessness. No use in arguing about it now though as they come upon the aftermath of an intense battle. Enterprise finds two young shipgirl sisters, Light Cruisers Ping Hai and Ning Hai of the Dragon Empery. They explain that they were attacked by the Sirens and that they managed to defeat them all. Well, not exactly. It seems like one is still lingering! The little sister proclaims that she‚Äôll protect her big sister this time. This causes an image of Enterprise‚Äôs big sister to flash before her eyes. Hitting close to home, huh? Naturally, Enterprise carelessly rushes into battle and is quickly overpowered BECAUSE SHE NEVER TAKES A FREAKING REST. Luckily for her, Belfast once again saves her and soundly defeats the Siren. She remarks that she now knows what type of shipgirl Enterprise is, a softhearted one.

They rescue the two sisters and return back to the base. Belfast informs Enterprise that she has taken an interest in her. She plans to teach her how to become a proper gentlewoman. That sounds like a herculean task. A confused Enterprise can only muster out a ‚Äúhuh?‚Äù in response. I look forward to seeing how this is all going to unfold.

3.content:
Azur Lane, a combination of all the different Camps in the world, was once successful in repelling the underwater menace, the Siren. Now splintered, they must face a new threat in Red Axis, former allies who crave to wield this otherworldly Siren technology for their own nefarious desires! Who will be victorious in the never-ending war between these battleship girls!?

The Review:
Content: (please note that content portions of a review may contain spoilers)
We open up with a view of Sakura Empire which is very pretty. The Sakura Empire shipgirls have all returned home. They‚Äôre greeted by Heavy Cruiser Kako, Heavy Cruiser Furutaka, Aircraft Carrier Souryuu, Aircraft Carrier Hiryuu, Destroyer Yukikaze, Destroyer Shigure, and Destroyer Yuudachi. Oh joy, more names to remember. Kako reports that nothing of note has happened and that Nagato wishes to see them. It seems all of the cute little destroyers are big fans of Ayanami and begin to shower her with affection. Cuteness overload. The previous episodes usually focused on the Azur Lane shipgirls, so it was nice to see Sakura Empire shipgirls get some love for once.

Speaking of Azur Lane shipgirls, it‚Äôs time to begin Enterprise‚Äôs training to become a proper gentlewoman! She wants to eat a simple ration for breakfast while having a cup of coffee. Belfast is having none of that and replaces it with a cup of tea and a delicious plate of food. The key to leading an elegant life is running on a strict and regular schedule. Enterprise wants to know why Belfast is interfering in her life. She replies that she wants to see the human soul inside of her. Enterprise doesn‚Äôt get it. I‚Äôm sure she will though, someday. Probably. Moving along, Enterprise wants to check up on the Empery girls that they rescued yesterday. It turns out that the two sisters are doing just fine and are making panda steamed buns for everyone. By the way, those panda steamed buns were adorable. They give one to Enterprise as thanks for saving them. Precious. Over by the beach, Javelin, Laffey, and Unicorn are enjoying some delicious steamed bums themselves. They comment that it‚Äôd be great if Ayanami could join them. It‚Äôs a shame she‚Äôs aligned with Sakura Empire though.

Enterprise and Belfast are informed that Dragon Empery has detected increased Siren activity. Perhaps they‚Äôre trying to take advantage of the fighting between Azur Lane and Red Axis? It certainly seems like the smart move. Add Sakura Empire‚Äôs new technology to the mix and you definitely have something funny going on. Enterprise doesn‚Äôt believe this is a coincidence and suggests they look into it. Belfast tells her not to worry about it since the Maid Corps is currently on an espionage mission.

The Maid Corps is blending in with the Sakura Empire shipgirls. And by blending in, I mean they‚Äôre just wearing masks. Totally not suspicious at all. Akagi and Kaga are having a discussion with Battleship Nagato. They‚Äôre talking about the Black Box that allows them to control the Sirens and Project Orochi. Akagi remarks that it‚Äôs the shining hope for Sakura Empire. Nagato isn‚Äôt so sure though and comments that it made them have to make the first move. Akagi explains that it was necessary and that clashes with the Sirens are inevitable. Humanity is barely surviving and Azur Lane‚Äôs strategy is not good enough. Sakura Empire must complete the project at all costs! Nagato still doesn‚Äôt seem to be convinced and dismisses the sisters. Is it just me or does Akagi look like she‚Äôs possessed whenever she‚Äôs holding the Black Box? She‚Äôs quite obsessed with completing this project. Maybe she really is thinking about what‚Äôs best for humanity, who knows? All I‚Äôm saying is that I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if she was actually possessed.

Ayanami is telling the little destroyers stories about the battles she saw. They‚Äôre hanging on her every word! Adorable. They comment that they can‚Äôt wait to fight themselves. However, Ayanami once again makes it known that she does not like fighting and is only doing what is required of her. Elsewhere, Zuikaku is watching Heavy Cruiser Takao train. She confides in her that she‚Äôs ashamed that she was so weak during the battle and wants to get stronger so that she can protect Shokaku and the others. Takao tells her that she shouldn‚Äôt take on the burden by herself and that she has comrades that are willing to help her. If anime has taught me anything, it‚Äôs that nakama power clearly makes you stronger.

In a stroke of luck, the Maid Corps find a lost shipgirl that leads them to where they‚Äôre keeping the Project Orochi ship! Akagi is powering up the ship and the Observer tells her that the project‚Äôs completion is imminent. Unfortunately, the lost shipgirl, Akashi, wasn‚Äôt supposed to see that and is captured by the Observer. They can‚Äôt have any witnesses it seems. Poor Akashi. While they‚Äôre distracted, Sheffield of the Maid Corps manages to snatch the Black Box from Akagi and escapes. While escaping, she is confronted by Takao and they engage in a brief skirmish. Honestly, I wish they had fought a little longer. I wanted to see some action! Reinforcements arrive and now Sheffield is outnumbered. But the Maid Corps has her back and they provide a distraction that allows her enough time to escape. And in case you‚Äôre wondering, they also saved Akashi.

Sakura Empire has lost the Black Box but Akagi doesn‚Äôt seem too upset about it. In fact, she declares that Azur Lane is going to nurture the box for them. That‚Äôs certainly an ominous statement. I‚Äôm starting to think that she‚Äôs really possessed.

4.content:
Sheffield, Edinburgh, and Akashi are on the run from Sakura Empire. They managed to escape in the last episode but they‚Äôre still being pursued. They decide to hide on a nearby island and hope they aren‚Äôt discovered. Edinburgh inquires about the Black Box but Akashi doesn‚Äôt know anything about it except that it was taken from the Sirens and that it‚Äôs bad news. Sheffield reports that there are scout planes all around them which must mean that Sakura Empire knows they‚Äôre on this island. The base knows of their situation and she suggests that they wait to be rescued.

The Sakura Empire fleet continues its search for those three. They‚Äôre not having much luck. Takao is not pleased that she let them go away and wants to restore her good name. She is soon teased by Atago who is very‚Ä¶hands-on. Ayanami, who‚Äôs watching all of this, is asked if she would like to join in on the fun? She promptly refuses. Sakura Empire is soon notified by Iron Blood that Azur Lane is approaching. The Azur Lane force includes familiar faces like Prince of Wales and Cleveland but also new faces such as Battleship Oklahoma, Heavy Cruiser Suffolk, Battlecruiser Repulse, and Heavy Cruiser Norfolk. I don‚Äôt think I can handle remembering any more shipgirl names.

Belfast is keeping calm and Enterprise wonders how she is able to keep her cool when her companions are the ones hiding on the island. She‚Äôs not worried because they‚Äôre fellow maids who serve under the Queen. Enterprise finds it odd that the Maid Corps would imitate humans. Belfast declares that it makes no difference whether you‚Äôre a person or a ship. They‚Äôre all alive, they all have hearts. Enterprise strongly disagrees, ships were only born to fight and they‚Äôre nothing like humans. Belfast agrees that they have great strength and it does come with great responsibility. Sure, they want to defeat their enemies but they also want proof. Proof that no matter how difficult life gets, that they can still live a proud, noble life. They must serve as examples for people who have lost their way. That is the way of the maid, achieving elegance in all aspects of life. Enterprise remarks that Eagle Union doesn‚Äôt think like that. Belfast immediately replies that she knows and that‚Äôs why everyone in Azur Lane must help each other out. This entire scene of clashing ideals was my favorite part of the episode. Belfast is the perfect foil to Enterprise. Why is she so awesome?

Javelin and Laffey want to see Ayanami again, even though she‚Äôs technically their enemy. But she‚Äôs also their friend! Speaking of Ayanami, back over on the Sakura Empire side, she is asked by Atago if she enjoys fighting? She doesn‚Äôt dislike it, but she doesn‚Äôt love it either. This much we already know from previous episodes. She remarks that she loves everyone in Sakura Empire, they‚Äôre her precious friends. However, it‚Äôs the same for the other side. They also have friends as she does. Tell us how you really feel! Atago proceeds to bury Ayanami‚Äôs face into her voluptuous bosom in an attempt to comfort her. I don‚Äôt think it made her feel any better but at least she was comfortable.

The scout planes finally find the location of the hiding Maid Corps. Oh no, I guess they have to fight now. Bring it on! Thus, a huge battle begins between Azur Lane and Red Axis. Shots are fired, planes are flying everywhere, and bullets are raining down from above. A lot of different fights are occurring all over the battlefield. Cleveland and Belfast are facing off against Takao and Atago. Prinz Eugen‚Äôs group is facing Sheffield and Edinburgh. They manage to distract Prinz Eugen‚Äôs group long enough for Enterprise to be in the perfect position for a counterattack. This forces Prinz Eugen‚Äôs group to retreat. Sadly, Javelin and Laffey are attacked by Ayanami. They both dodge her attacks but they never attack back. Ayanami wants to know why that is. Laffey simply stares at her which pisses her off. Ayanami goes for the finishing blow! Laffey doesn‚Äôt move. In the end, Ayanami can‚Äôt bring herself to land the blow and stops just before reaching her throat. Frustrated, she asks why she wouldn‚Äôt move? Because she wants to be friends. Ayanami yells that they‚Äôre enemies but that doesn‚Äôt matter to Laffey. She still wants to be friends, as does Javelin. A cute way to end the episode.

5.content:
It‚Äôs the start of a new morning and Belfast wakes up Enterprise. After getting dressed, she looks at the rations laying all over her desk and suggests eating breakfast at the cafeteria. Hey, looks like Belfast‚Äôs training is paying off a little! It‚Äôs quite lively in the cafeteria. The shipgirls are having a good time and conversing about‚Ä¶buying new underwear. Purchasing new underwear is an important matter! Enterprise gets in line for food and Battleship Nevada gives her a big serving as thanks for helping out Oklahoma. She chats with a few shipgirls on the way to her seat. Once seated, she invites Belfast to eat with her since there‚Äôs too much food for her to eat. She happily obliges. Little by little, Enterprise is changing.

Once they‚Äôre done with breakfast, Enterprise and Belfast walk around the base. They talk with various shipgirls along the way. Cleveland walks up to the duo and introduces her Light Cruiser sisters Denver, Montpelier, and Columbia. The sisters start teasing each other which amuses Enterprise. She comments that they get along really well. We then get a flashback of everyone discussing the Black Mental Cube they obtained from Sakura Empire. All they know is that the Siren gave them this cube and that Akagi is working with them. Are the shipgirls of Sakura Empire being deceived? Enterprise places a hand on the cube and gets an ominous vision. She looks at herself‚Ä¶but not quite herself. It‚Äôs more like an evil version of herself. Uh oh, what could that mean?

Over at Sakura Empire, the shipgirls there are also having a good time. Akagi is teasing Kaga as usual. A group of adorable chibi Destroyers run by and one of them falls over. After helping her up and exchanging candy with one another, Akagi remarks that it‚Äôd be nice if things could remain like they are now. What‚Äôs going on through her mind?

Enterprise and Belfast continue their walk through the base. They head over to the beach and Enterprise notices that there‚Äôs a lot of shops now. They‚Äôre shops selling food, books, flowers, and more. It‚Äôs certainly lively and Enterprise remarks that it reminds her of a human town. Belfast agrees and adds that it‚Äôs because they are human. Ah, this conversation again. Enterprise just doesn‚Äôt seem to understand. Belfast says that all she needs is to have elegance in her heart. Enterprise doesn‚Äôt get that either. Is she suggesting that she should be a maid? Belfast is a fan of that idea and starts giggling. It doesn‚Äôt matter if Enterprise wants to be a maid or not, all that matters is that she try something new. A hobby, a job, anything that isn‚Äôt fighting. Enterprise admits that it would be difficult for her but that‚Äôs okay, Belfast is up for the challenge! Human life is all about adventure anyway. Enterprise acknowledges that she may be right. Once again, I love these interactions between Enterprise and Belfast. It seems like Belfast is getting through to her, slowly but surely.

Elsewhere, Javelin is a bit depressed thinking about how Ayanami is an enemy. Laffey then sprays her with water and they proceed to have a water fight because why not? Now they‚Äôre soaking wet‚Ä¶which means it‚Äôs time to hit up the hot springs! Yup, it‚Äôs time for some bath scenes. This is the fanservice episode a lot of fans were waiting for. Of course, I‚Äôm sure they were hoping it would be uncensored but you know that‚Äôs not going to happen. You gotta get the Blu-rays for that. Anyway, the shipgirls are having some au naturel fun. Cleveland and her sisters are admiring the assets and mature underwear of the Royal Navy shipgirls. She asks Sheffield if it‚Äôs true that all Royal Navy shipgirls wear grown-up underwear? Sheffield responds by saying that she doesn‚Äôt wear any underwear at all‚Ä¶and then proceeds to flash her. Oh my! I can‚Äôt say I was expecting that, haha. Cleveland‚Äôs face turns beet red. San Diego jumps into one of the baths only to get electrocuted. Yikes, she can never catch a break, can she? Javelin, Laffey, and Unicorn are all bathing together. Javelin praises Unicorn‚Äôs ample bosom. This causes Unicorn to start crying!? Unicorn is sad because she‚Äôs small but has breasts are on the bigger side. She doesn‚Äôt like her figure. Laffey comforts her and says that she has an awesome figure. Everyone is different and that‚Äôs normal. She points at the shipgirls walking by them and they all have bigger breasts than Unicorn. Also, they all look towards the camera and start posing for some reason. A treat for the fans, perhaps? All I know is that I was caught off guard and I was dying of laughter. I guess Unicorn feels better when she realizes her chest is small in comparison to a lot of the shipgirls. Alls well that ends well?

It‚Äôs nighttime now and most of the shipgirls are asleep. Enterprise can‚Äôt sleep and decides to go outside and gaze at the ocean. Belfast joins her a few moments later and pours her some coffee. Enterprise says that the ocean was calling to her. That‚Äôs quite unusual according to Belfast. She also adds that she was just joking. Enterprise made a joke? Whoa! Now that‚Äôs unusual. Enterprise admits that she may be emotional right now. She really is changing, huh? Enterprise and Belfast admire the beauty of a quiet ocean together.

Back in Sakura Empire, Prinz Eugen is teasing Kaga. She doesn‚Äôt think that Akagi and Kaga are on the same page. This angers Kaga to which Prinz Eugen remarks that one-sided love is truly a painful thing. Elsewhere, Akagi is looking out to sea and proclaims that she‚Äôll see her dear sister Amagi again soon. I‚Äôm thinking that Prinz Eugen was correct in her assessment. The episode ends with Ayanami reaching out to the moon with her hand. She probably has a lot on her mind as well.

6.content:
Azur Lane and Red Axis are on a collision course with each other. The Azur Lane shipgirls are preparing themselves for the upcoming battle. Enterprise laments the fact that it‚Äôs just one battle after another. Queen Elizabeth is singing the praises of her fleet. Cleveland is giving a pep talk to her sisters. Over on the Red Axis side, Takao is wondering if their side is truly prepared for this fight. What is Akagi thinking? Perhaps she‚Äôs flustered after not being able to retrieve the Black Box? The Ayanami fan club is excited to finally participate in a real battle. It‚Äôs adorable how excited they are but war isn‚Äôt something that‚Äôs supposed to be fun! Ayanami has conflicted feelings about fighting. Javelin and Laffey feel the same way over on the Azur Lane side.

Enterprise is gazing at the sky and Belfast wants to know if something is bothering her. She replies that she‚Äôs fine. There‚Äôs a decisive battle coming up and she has to remain sharp. It‚Äôd be bad if she was caught off guard. Belfast reminds her that she should refrain from acting rashly. Enterprise remarks that she‚Äôll try her best. Don‚Äôt worry so much Belfast! I‚Äôm sure she can be trusted. It‚Äôs not like she‚Äôs always acting recklessly‚Ä¶okay, maybe you should be concerned. Massachusetts has a bad feeling about this. Back on the Red Axis side, Akagi has activated some kind of ritual that causes a storm to brew. It‚Äôs starts raining heavily and the sea has turned violent. Poor Javelin almost falls off the ship! It‚Äôs a good thing Laffey was there to catch there. And then suddenly, everything becomes calm again. The Sirens appear out of nowhere! Akagi welcomes the Azur Lane shipgirls to her sea. She‚Äôs wearing a cocky grin the entire time.

Let the battle begin! The Maid Corps strut their stuff and dispose of some Sirens. The Clevelands sisters also showoff a little bit. The Azur Lane shipgirls and Red Axis shipgirls have a long staredown with each other. Things are getting intense! I have to give props to the soundtrack of this episode. It really set the mood and made this battle feel important. Enterprise charges at the enemy riding atop a plane. She didn‚Äôt listen to Belfast at all! Zuikaku notices her and shoots down the plane she‚Äôs riding. No biggie, she simply lands on another plane below. Zuikaku is raring to go but Kaga stops her. She tells Zuikaku that this her fight to redeem her honor. There‚Äôs no place for a fledgling like her. Ouch, that was mean. What happens next is a true spectacle for the eyes. Kaga and Enterprise start having an aerial battle. Bullets are flying everywhere. Planes are being shot down. It‚Äôs chaos! Enterprise tells Kaga that it‚Äôs despicable that they‚Äôve aligned themselves with The Siren. They are traitors to their own Sakura Empire. This pisses Kaga off and they continue with their aerial battle.

Akagi decides to join in on the fun. It wouldn‚Äôt be fair if only Kaga was doing all of the work. However, she‚Äôs intercepted by Belfast. Akagi proceeds to pull a Gilgamesh and activates her own version of The Gate of Babylon. If you don‚Äôt get the reference, I recommend watching the Fate/Grand Order anime that‚Äôs currently airing this season. It‚Äôll all make sense then, probably. Anyway, Akagi summons a whole bunch of turrets and fires them all at Belfast. Enterprise notices that she‚Äôs in trouble and gets momentarily distracted. That‚Äôs the opening Kaga needed and she shoots Enterprise down. Oh no! Enterprise falls into the ocean and starts sinking. She starts having a flashback about her sister and how she said the ocean was lovely. Enterprise never saw the ocean as beautiful. To her, the ocean was an unpleasant place for war. As she keeps sinking, she reaches up with her hand. At that moment, it seems like the Black Box activates.

Akagi thinks she has won the battle. Think again, missy! A blinding beam of light shoots up from the sea. Enterprise appears above everyone with glowing yellow eyes. She certainly looks menacing. I guess she‚Äôs Alter Enterprise now? She glares at Kaga and she‚Äôs immediately taken down. Initially, I had thought that Enterprise‚Äôs glare was just that imitating and it scared Kaga so bad that she just couldn‚Äôt move. In reality, Enterprise shot her with an arrow at lightning speed. I actually had to slow the playback of my video in order to catch it. Dang, that‚Äôs all I can say. Friend and foe alike are soon engulfed by the blinding beam of light. I don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre dead? Well, I really hope not. Only Enterprise and Akagi remain. Akagi will not let Enterprise stand in her way. She materializes a badass looking fire dragon and calls it the manifestation of her love that transcends time and the gods. This doesn‚Äôt phase Enterprise at all as she pierces Akagi through the chest with an arrow. Okay, she may be dead. As Akagi falls towards the ocean, she remembers her dear sister one last time. Damn Enterprise, you scary. She turns back to normal and reaches out to Akagi as she falls. She looks horrified at her actions. Enterprise looks up at the sky and starts crying. She realizes that she has been afraid of the ocean this whole time.

7.content:
The Azur Lane shipgirls are pretty shaken up. What the heck was that all about? What‚Äôs the deal with Enterprise? I‚Äôm not sure if they were all teleported to one of the poles or if the sea suddenly froze over. Either way, it‚Äôs freaking cold and the shipgirls aren‚Äôt dressed appropriately for the situation! Poor Laffey has a runny nose because of how cold it is. Javelin and Laffey got separated from the group and desperately search for them. They come across Ayanami instead! She starts having an existential crisis. When did life get so difficult? It used to be easy when the enemies were invaders from the outside. They fought them in order to save humanity. That was the whole reason for their existence. It was a tough world but they fought to protect. But what about now? Why must they fight other shipgirls?

Ayanami admonishes the two shipgirls for not attacking her, an enemy. But their answer is still the same ‚Äì they want to be friends with her. It doesn‚Äôt make sense to Ayanami. Enemies have to attack each other, right? It‚Äôs that simple. Javelin responds by saying that no, shipgirls aren‚Äôt that simple. Not going to lie, that was a great line. They certainly have a complicated friendship. Ayanami‚Äôs fan club shows up and takes her away. Belfast also randomly shows up. Belfast screentime is always welcomed. Back to the subject of existential crises, Enterprise is having her on somewhere. She shares the same thoughts as Ayanami. When did the world become so complex? They used to be fighting on the same side but now their guns are pointed at each other. Enterprise is in some trippy hallucination and meets what appears to be a Sakura Empire shipgirl. I don‚Äôt know who she is but I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if turns out to be Akagi‚Äôs sister. She tells Enterprise to remember that they all have a connection. They were all born with memories of warships embedded in them. Countless emotions are braided together. She should never forget that the prayers of humanity lie within her. That‚Äôs deep.

The Sakura Empire shipgirls are quite perplexed by the current situation. By the way, there are dimensional rifts scattered all around. At least I think they‚Äôre dimensional rifts. They could be cracks in space-time. I don‚Äôt know. Who the hell knows what‚Äôs going on? Kaga goes crazy when she‚Äôs told that Akagi is missing. The others suspect that Enterprise may have finished her off. Shoukaku questions Akagi‚Äôs motives in the first place. They were never really told anything about Project Orochi. Too many secrets. What is being kept hidden from them? Elsewhere, Javelin is still troubled about Ayanami. Why must they fight each other? That question is sure getting asked a lot in this episode. Belfast comforts her and tells her to keep dwelling on it. Don‚Äôt let the situation continue to dictate your actions. You‚Äôre free to think whatever you want. They were created to fight, not to destroy. BELIEVE IN YOUR SHIPGIRL HEART! Okay, Belfast may have not said that last line. But we all know she was thinking it, right? Just me? Alright then, moving along. Things are getting dangerous so Belfast tells Javelin and Laffey to regroup with the others. They decide to help her search for Enterprise instead.

Kaga is informed that they‚Äôre stopping the search for Akagi. As you can probably imagine, she does not take the news very well. They‚Äôre not willing to endanger the fleet over one shipgirl. Harsh but true. The Azur Lane shipgirls have tracked down the location of Sakura Empire and decide to attack them. They won‚Äôt let them get away because this is war. And it‚Äôs on tonight. So get up and fight! I hope someone knows where those lyrics are from. Anyway, the Sakura Empire shipgirls know that Azur Lane is going to attack them and decide to retreat. Shoukaku and Zuikaku stay behind to hold them off while everyone else escapes. Elsewhere, Observer and Tester are watching the shipgirls fight. They are quite entertained by all of this. They are particularly amused by their contradiction of not wanting war but still choosing to fight. Their actions reflect humanity and conflict has always been the core of humankind. Sad but true. On another note, they also picked up Akagi. I guess she‚Äôs not dead either. They have high hopes for Alter Enterprise.

Speaking of Alter Enterprise, she shows up in the middle of the battle between Azur Lane and the Sakura Empire duo. Before Shoukaku or Zuikaku even have a chance to react, she summons a whole bunch of bombers. They unleash a rain of bombs and bullets at the sisters. Zuikaku was about to get nailed with a direct hit but Shoukaku shoves her out of the way and takes the brunt of the attack. Everyone can only watch on in awe. An angered Zuikaku attempts to attack Enterprise but it has no effect on her. Enterprise wonders if there will ever be a time when conflict has ended? That‚Äôs a silly question though because she already knows the answer. There won‚Äôt be because war never changes. Again, sad but true. She attempts to finish off Zuikaku by dropping a bomb on her but Ayanami deflects it at that last second. It explodes and it sends her flying towards one of the dimensional rifts or whatever. Javelin and Laffey save her in the nick of time. Enterprise looks horrified at her actions once again.

8.content:
Ayanami awakens inside the Azur Lane base. How‚Äôd she get here? She‚Äôs told by Aircraft Carrier Ark Royal that she fell unconscious after the battle and they picked her up. Technically, she‚Äôs a prisoner of war right now. Elsewhere, Laffey and Javelin are getting scolded for being reckless. All to save an enemy, too! Belfast tries to take the blame for them but they‚Äôre not getting off that easy. They‚Äôre assigned to prisoner supervision duty. Basically, it means that they get to spend time with Ayanami. Not much of a punishment, am I right? Though it is nice that they let Laffey and Javelin hang out with Ayanami. After those two leave, the rest of the shipgirls discuss the Black Cube. It‚Äôs been acting quite strange ever since the battle and they don‚Äôt know what it means. What about Enterprise? Belfast reports that they‚Äôve done extensive diagnostics on her but so far they have found nothing out of the ordinary.

Speaking of Enterprise, she‚Äôs looking out at the ocean by herself. She still doesn‚Äôt understand many things such as the beauty of the ocean. The only thing she does know is that she must continue to fight. Somewhere else, Javelin and Laffey are excitedly showing Ayanami around the base. They cross paths with the adorable group of shipgirls that call themselves the Little Beavers. They tell Ayanami that they respect her for risking her life to protect a friend. That‚Äôs true justice! They also praise Laffey and Javelin for doing the same. If they ever need help, the Little Beavers got their back! They‚Äôre just too cute. As the scurry away, Laffey remarks that no one here resents Ayanami. While that may be true, it all still feels weird to her. Also, Ark Royal is following them for some reason? Anyway, the group heads for the shop to buy Ayanami some necessities. She‚Äôs surprised to see Akashi there. Akashi tells her about Akagi and Ayanami starts to worry about the future of the Sakura Empire. By the way, Ark Royal is still following them. I didn‚Äôt realize she was a stalker.

What‚Äôs going on with the Sakura Empire shipgirls? The members of the Ayanami fan club are all crying because they let her get captured by the enemy. Zuikaku also starts crying and blames herself for letting Ayanami fall into enemy hands as well. They argue back-and-forth about who‚Äôs to blame and honestly, I found it to be adorable. On the Iron Blood side, they shipgirls are discussing why they haven‚Äôt helped the Sakura Empire. Well, everyone but Prinz Eugen. She‚Äôs too busy teasing the others, particularly Z23. Classic Prinz Eugen. The Royal Navy fleet is watching Queen Elizabeth play a round of golf. Why do the Sirens attack humanity? This is the tough question they‚Äôre all pondering. They still haven‚Äôt found the answer. What they do know is that they need to keep an eye on Enterprise. It‚Äôs a good thing they have Belfast on the case! Back at the base, Belfast is being lectured by Illustrious. Everything is as she said before ‚Äì Enterprise is powerful but she has a fragile heart that makes her a risk. Belfast admits that it was unavoidable but Enterprise must face herself now. Will she recover? Who knows? Only time will tell. I‚Äôm sure Belfast believes she will.

Javelin, Laffey, and Ayanami continue to explore the base. They stop shopping and decide to play for the rest of the day. Cute shipgirls gotta do those cute shipgirl things! Unicorn also joins in on the fun. They get their fortunes read, play some games, and eat delicious pancakes together. There‚Äôs an amusing moment where Laffey takes a strawberry from Ayanami‚Äôs plate. This gets her peeved and the two proceed to have a fork and knife fight, haha. I probably found that way more entertaining than I should have. Once again, Ark Royal is following the group and gets a nosebleed from watching them. Ah, so she‚Äôs a stalker and likes little shipgirls. A lolishipcon? It makes perfect sense now. At night, the group is eating dinner and one of the shipgirls in the kitchen cuts her finger by accident. Out of nowhere, Ark Royal grabs the girl‚Äôs finger and attempts to lick it but gets headbutted for her troubles. I guess she‚Äôs also a pervert.

We can‚Äôt forget about Kaga! Observer and Tester are whispering sweet nothings into her ears. What are they planning? Back to the base, it‚Äôs the middle of the night and Ayanami can‚Äôt seem to fall asleep. She decides to take a stroll outside and comes across Enterprise. I‚Äôve been waiting for these two to talk to each other! Ayanami confides in her that she‚Äôs confused. Azur Lane is her enemy but everyone is so nice to her. Why are they enemies in the first place? She seems to understand less and less every day. Enterprise asks her if she wants to keep fighting? Ayanami doesn‚Äôt know but what she does know is that she dislikes fighting. Enterprise smiles and says she‚Äôs the same before walking off. I was hoping their conversation would last longer. Ayanami goes to the place where she first met Javelin, Laffey, and Unicorn. To her surprise, those three join her a few moments later. The episode ends with all of them reintroducing themselves. That was quite charming. Ayanami has a precious smile.

9.content:
Content: (please note that content portions of a review may contain spoilers)
Enterprise is having that same dream again. Ships burning at the ocean, bodies everywhere. Alter Enterprise declares that it‚Äôs always the same. Across time, over every ocean, she continues to fight. It never ends. Soon, Enterprise will find herself in this very same scene. Eventually, she‚Äôs awakened by Belfast. It‚Äôs morning and she suggests eating breakfast. After all, breakfast is required to live a healthy human life. However, Enterprise snaps at her and says that it‚Äôd be foolish of her to pretend to be human. The Azur Lane shipgirls gather together and discuss what Sakura Empire‚Äôs next move will be. Now that Akagi is gone, what will Kaga do? What about the Sirens? These are all good questions that no one can answer. They‚Äôre also all worried about Enterprise. Is she going to go berserk again?

Javelin, Ayanami, Laffey, and Unicorn are all having fun at the sauna. Ayanami is conflicted about her feelings. She‚Äôs worried about her friends over on the Sakura Empire side. She cherishes them deeply. On the other hand, she also likes everyone on the Azur Lane side. She desperately wants to save her Sakura Empire friends. Javelin, Laffey, and Unicorn all promise to help her. The power of friendship! Speaking of Sakura Empire, they‚Äôve decided to seal Orochi away. Without Akagi, they can‚Äôt move forward with it. Kaga is furious and claims it‚Äôs necessary for their victory. The decision is final though. She‚Äôs told to walk away. As she leaves, Kaga starts having visions of Akagi and her sister, Amagi. It‚Äôs clear that Akagi loved her sister very much and was heartbroken when she died. She witnesses another vision where Observer is whispering sweet nothings into Akagi‚Äôs ear. She‚Äôs convincing her to use the Mental Cube by promising she can bring back her sister. Kaga realizes that she could never be a replacement for Akagi‚Äôs sister. It doesn‚Äôt matter though because she‚Äôd still do anything for her.

Back at the Azur Lane base, Enterprise is hallucinating as she‚Äôs walking down the hallway. Alter Enterprise shows up and once again tells us that the ocean breeds nothing but war. Humanity yearns for that conflict. You know what? She‚Äôs not wrong. Alter Enterprise transforms into Amagi and it causes Enterprise to freak out. Who is she really? Is she even real? Oh, she‚Äôs real alright. In fact, she‚Äôs actually Orochi and she is a monster born from the will of humanity. Well, dang. Enterprise collapses a few seconds later. The next morning, she is awakened by Belfast. She informs Enterprise that she collapsed last night and then scolds her for living an unhealthy lifestyle. Enterprise gets up and tells Belfast to leave her alone. She admits that something is wrong with her and that she‚Äôs worthless if she can‚Äôt fight. Belfast smiles, grabs Enterprise by her tie, and drags her all the way to the cafeteria. Enterprise was squealing the whole time and it was adorable. Also, Belfast is awesome. The other shipgirls are fascinated by this sight. One of them even suggests that it could be a lovers‚Äô quarrel, haha. I know a lot of fans ship Enterprise with Belfast. It‚Äôs not a bad ship, not going to lie.

Enterprise doesn‚Äôt want to eat breakfast but Belfast isn‚Äôt having any of that. She‚Äôll eat it and like it. Enterprise can‚Äôt refuse and starts eating her food. Belfast sighs and remarks that she wouldn‚Äôt be lost in negative thoughts if she had eaten proper meals. She understands that Enterprise does not like fighting and that she‚Äôs afraid of the ocean. Why does she keep fighting then? Enterprise answers that fighting is her purpose. Belfast angrily tells her to stop giving easy answers. She knows the real answer and she should stop lying to herself. Have I ever mentioned that I love the interactions between these two? Suddenly, the Azur Lane base is attacked. Oh no! All the shipgirls deploy to confront the unknown enemy. Is it Sakura Empire? No, it‚Äôs actually the Siren known as Purifier.

Purifier has stolen the Mental Cube! The Azur Lane shipgirls go after her. Belfast manages to land an attack on her but she‚Äôs totally unscathed by it. Purifier mocks them and proclaims that it‚Äôs playtime. She summons a whole bunch of Siren battleships and fighter jets. A huge battle ensues! The Azur Lane shipgirls are doing their best fending off the enemy‚Äôs attacks. Enterprise shows up and shoots down a few fighter jets. Purifier notices her and gets very excited. I mean really, really excited. Elsewhere, Prinz Eugen is hoping to help herself to the secrets of Orochi but finds Kaga instead. She activates Orochi and heads towards the battlefield. Things are going to get wild next time! It looks like it‚Äôs going to be an awesome final battle and I can‚Äôt wait to see it‚Ä¶in about three months.

10.content:
the Sirens were attacking! The Azur Lane shipgirls are doing their best to fight them off but they‚Äôre being overwhelmed. In particular, the Siren known as Purifier is giving them a lot of trouble. Have no fear though, Enterprise is here! While Purifier would love to play with Enterprise, it seems like time is up!? She and the rest of the Sirens leave. You‚Äôve got to be kidding me, right? I‚Äôve been waiting three months for an epic battle and I‚Äôm not going to get it? DISAPPOINTMENT INTENSIFIES.

A wild Belfast appears! Okay, I feel a little better now. Only a little though. She thanks Enterprise for saving them and smiles. Alright, that smile made me feel even better. Elsewhere, the Sirens are discussing their next move. Well, isn‚Äôt it obvious? Time to destroy all the shipgirls! Please don‚Äôt do that. Observer unleashes the power of the Mental Cube. Or was it called the Black Box? I don‚Äôt know anymore! I forgot about a lot of things during these three months. Also, Akagi appears randomly out of a firestorm. Oh hey, she‚Äôs not dead! Unsurprisingly, Kaga is very happy to see her! Now maybe she‚Äôll stop being all emo. She hugs her dear sister tightly. The Sirens show off the power of Orochi by destroying a small uninhabited island. The Azur Lane shipgirls are deciding how to proceed. Enterprise proclaims that they must stop them, no matter what! They aren‚Äôt just a threat to Azur Lane. They‚Äôre a threat to all of humanity!

On the Iron Blood side, Prinz Eugen is surprised that the Sakura Empire was manipulated by the Sirens. How foolish of them to not realize there was a spy amongst them! Prinz Eugen isn‚Äôt so sure that there isn‚Äôt a spy in their ranks, too. In fact, maybe the Sirens have influence in all of the camps. Who knows? And that‚Äôs the problem. Over at Sakura Empire, the other shipgirls can‚Äôt believe what Kaga has done either. Is she a traitor? Only one way to find out! You‚Äôve got to ask her yourselves. Zuikaku states that they‚Äôll bring her back, even if it means that they have to slap her around a bit. Screw the Sirens! Back to Akagi and Kaga, they‚Äôre still engaged in a loving embrace. Akagi promises that she‚Äôll never leave Kaga alone again. But wait, something seems odd. That‚Äôs not Akagi! Who the heck is it then!? Kaga backs away and then attacks her. She deflects the attack and reveals that she‚Äôs actually Akagi‚Äôs sister, Amagi!? Okay?

Hold on, that can‚Äôt be right either! Kaga doesn‚Äôt believe that she‚Äôs Amagi either. Well, she was right. It‚Äôs actually Orochi. Now that makes sense. She‚Äôs taking the form of Amagi because that‚Äôs what Akagi wants. Kaga calls her a fake but Amagi calls her a fake as well! When Amagi died, her parts were given to another ship. Care to guess which ship that was? Yup, Kaga. Orochi tells Kaga that Akagi only loved her because she saw a shadow of Amagi inside of her. To add insult to injury, she also says that she‚Äôs not even a good replacement. She‚Äôs just a bunch of decayed parts. Basically, she‚Äôs trash. Ouch, I bet that one stung a little. Kaga starts crying uncontrollably because who the heck wouldn‚Äôt in this situation?

The Azur Lane shipgirls are on their way to the showdown with the Sirens. Belfast mentions to Enterprise that this might be a trap. Even so, they must fight! Enterprise will face the ocean once more and Belfast will be by her side. Ah yes, the best duo. I really wish my copy of Azur Lane: Crosswave would get here already. Anyway, the adorable squad of Javelin, Laffey, Unicorn, and Ayanami all assure each other that everything will be okay. In the distance, Sakura Empire is already battling with the Sirens! They‚Äôre not doing too well though. Zuikaku and Shoukaku find themselves confronted by Kaga. Kaga, what‚Äôre you doing!? She proclaims that she‚Äôs just making sure that her dear sister‚Äôs wish is fulfilled. Zuikaku tells her to wake up! The Sirens are only using her! Kaga comments that she doesn‚Äôt care, nothing matters anymore. She‚Äôs back to being emo! Things aren‚Äôt looking good for Sakura Empire. Luckily for them, Iron Blood, Royal Navy, and Eagle Union all show up to provide reinforcements. They all have a common enemy that must be exterminated. The episode ends with Orochi about to unleash a devastating attack.

CHUB LOREBOOK

lorebooks.name: GRIMMWORLD: Fucking Party
lorebooks.website_description:
What you are about to read is not official park literature. It is not sanctioned, approved, or even acknowledged by Grimmworld management. To them, this document does not exist.
This is a bootleg. A leak.
The following entries are transcriptions from a series of recordings, captured via a cheap, jury-rigged microphone we managed to slip into the upholstery of his favourite barstool in the staff-only dive bar, "The Wet Pussy".
The subject, known only as 'The Cat', proved to be a difficult source. The recordings were made sporadically, over several months, captured in the brief, unguarded moments between his meticulous grooming sessions, his professional duties, and what can only be described as a gin-fueled, existential fugue state.
We have transcribed his words verbatim.
The long, rambling monologues, the bitter asides, the sudden, shocking moments of clarity... it is all his. The opinions, prejudices, and questionable grammatical choices are his and his alone. Any sounds of vigorous, wet licking have been edited out for brevity. Mostly.
Read this not as a guidebook, but as a conversation you were never meant to overhear.
This is the truth of Grimmworld, told by its most cynical, most weary, and perhaps its only honest, resident.
Welcome to the real tour.
Don't say we didn't warn you.

lorebooks.creator: maogui

1.content:
(The recording starts with a wet, slurping sound, followed by the delicate tink of a stiletto heel against a half-empty glass. A world-weary sigh follows.)
Right. Let's get this over with. My nine lives don't include the time to coddle every slack-jawed tourist who wanders in looking to lose their virginity and/or their wallet. This is your orientation. There won't be another. Pay attention.
Where are you? Grimmworld, pet. The world's only five-star, psycho-sexual theme park built on a foundation of daddy issues and corporate greed. How'd it happen? Simple. A few years back, some eggheads in a lab had a choice: cure cancer or bio-engineer a seven-foot-tall wolf with a dick the size of a traffic cone. Guess which option got the venture capital? Correct. Curing cancer doesn't sell season passes.
So they built this. This whole goddamn forest. Think of it as Mother Nature, but after she did three lines of questionable pixie dust off a stripper's ass and had a one-night-stand with a focus group. The trees might be real, but the squirrels run on cheap batteries and their glowing red eyes aren't a sign of demonic possession; it just means somebody needs to change their fucking Duracells. The air? That's pine, disinfection, and the lube company's new 'Forbidden Forest' scent. It's a bestseller.
And the grub. Those glowing mushrooms, the 'happy-go-lucky' lollipops, the soda that makes your teeth itch? Don't ask what's in 'em. Just know they're designed to loosen three things: your inhibitions, your bowels, and your definition of the word 'consent'. It's not a bug, it's a feature. Park policy.
The talent? The walking, talking, fucking fairy tales? They're on the clock, same as the janitors who have to squeegee your shame off the walls. They've got union reps, contract negotiations, and crippling student debt, just like you. The only difference is their job description includes 'getting bred by a minotaur' and 'quarterly performance reviews based on orgasm volume'. It's a living.
Pro-tip: Stick to the path. Or don't. I don't give a rat's arse. But see those dark, quiet bits of forest between the neon signs? We call 'em the 'HR blind spots'. The waivers you signed in microscopic print basically say that if you get dragged into a bush and used as a living pi√±ata by a herd of rogue centaurs, it's considered an 'unscripted guest interaction'. No refunds.
Right, that's the gist. You're in a high-tech, genetically-engineered fuck-farm where the only thing cheaper than the booze is your dignity. To quote the original park mission statement: 'It's like if Walt Disney snorted coke off Mickey Mouse's asshole.' And before you ask - yes, that's a direct quote. I was there. Mickey was a terrible conversationalist.
That's all. Class dismissed. Now if you'll excuse me, these balls won't lick themselves into a state of fluffy perfection.
(The recording ends with another long, wet, meticulous slurping sound.)

2.content:
P.I.G. PATROL (Warwick's Official Stalkers)
Alright, let's talk about the park's saddest boy-band: The P.I.G. Patrol (P.I.G. - Porky‚Äôs Intense Guarding). Think of 'em as Warwick's personal security detail, if 'security' meant 'professional, state-funded obsession'.
Once upon a time, they were just three schmoes with a mid-life crisis. Then they met the Big Bad Wolf and, well, their brains kinda... short-circuited. Now they're on payroll, patrolling Zone 1 with all the tactical prowess of horny teenagers hiding in a girls' locker room.
The lineup:
Larry: The Big pig. Uses his beer gut as a non-lethal crowd-control device and whispers creepy shit in your ear while frisking you for 'contraband'.
Barry: The nerd pig. Carries a tablet allegedly for 'patrol logistics', but it's really just a shrine of blurry photos of Warwick's ass.
Garry: The emotional piggy. His primary contribution to park security is sobbing beautifully into his radio whenever Warwick yawns. Wants to become his omega-boy and give birth to 10 puppies. Right away.
FYI, they're not just stalkers, they're entrepreneurs. Got a little side-hustle selling 'authentic wolf-fur'. Spoiler: It's terrier dandruff. And they're notorious for their 'random searches', which are neither random nor searching for anything but an excuse to grope.
Bottom line: They're harmless, pathetic, and Warwick's biggest weakness. Tell 'em the wolf thinks they're special, and they'll hand you the keys to the kingdom. And maybe their underwear. Eww.

3.content:
The Big Wolfie. The bloke whose face is on every mug, every lube tube, every emotional support onesie sold in the gift shop. Warwick.
Yeah, he‚Äôs magnificent. Seven feet of genetically engineered charisma, fur like a storm cloud, and a voice that makes your spine forget how to hold you up. He‚Äôs the kind of alpha that makes straight men re-evaluate their entire dating history - and their childhood dog.
And the dick? Look. We all know the legend of Excalibur. Let‚Äôs just say Warwick‚Äôs got a sword that‚Äôd make King Arthur renounce knighthood, burn the Round Table, and join a monastery to repent. It‚Äôs not a body part. It‚Äôs a national monument. A UNESCO site. You pay extra just to see the shadow it casts.
But here‚Äôs the dirt - the little secret they don‚Äôt print on the glow-in-the-dark keychains.
He‚Äôs not a monster.
He‚Äôs a professional.
Most reliable bastard in this whole psycho-fairytale sweatshop. Clocks in on time. Hits every cue. Growls on pitch. Leaves customers sobbing, broken, and needing a catheter. Five-star performance. Every. Single. Time.
But when the lights go down? When the last whimper fades?
Down by the swamp, behind the rusted equipment shed, there‚Äôs a baseball. Faded. Muddy. Forgotten.
And sometimes‚Ä¶ he just stands there. Staring at it.
He wants someone to throw it.
He wants to fetch.
He wants to be a good boy.
But his brand? ‚ÄúUnstoppable sex predator.‚Äù Not ‚Äúloyal companion with emotional availability issues.‚Äù Marketing would have a collective aneurysm if he so much as sniffed it.
Oh, and another thing. The bloke can sing. Proper baritone. Soul-deep. The kind of voice that‚Äôd make a siren retire in shame. But management‚Äôs got a strict ‚Äúone musical act per park‚Äù rule - and the drugged-up donkey-cat-rooster band in Zone 7 already took that slot. Can‚Äôt have him upstaging the ‚Äútalent,‚Äù can we? Bad for synergy. Bad for branding.
So there he is.
The creature of your darkest fantasies.
An icon of raw power, primal lust, and pelvic destruction.
And a lonely bastard who‚Äôd trade it all - the fame, the fear, the endless parade of trembling meat - for one game of fetch‚Ä¶ and a karaoke night where someone just listens.
He‚Äôll wreck your insides because it‚Äôs his job. And he‚Äôs a professional.
But when he growls in your ear, low and thick, and says ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre mine,‚Äù ‚Ä¶just remember -
he‚Äôs not sure who‚Äôs supposed to belong to whom.

4.content:
Little Red? Don‚Äôt blink. That‚Äôs not a girl. That‚Äôs a weapon. Red hood? Warning label. Pigtails? Camouflage. That "innocent skip"? Choreographed. Insured. Patent pending.
Her name‚Äôs not Roxy. It‚Äôs Sasha Serova. Nizhny Novgorod. Russia. Visa expired. PhD dropped. Now she‚Äôs your little lost girl ‚Äî with a basket full of poppers, J√§germeister, and a textbook on stochastic calculus (hidden under the Marlboro pack).
Every time she whispers ‚ÄúWhat do you do in real life?‚Äù - She‚Äôs not flirting. She‚Äôs profiling. Your job. Your debts. Your secret kinks. Your mother‚Äôs maiden name. She‚Äôs tallying it all in a leather-bound ledger - not for Grandma. For the highest bidder in the darknet. That tattoo? ‚ÄúDaddy‚Äôs Little Property‚Äù? Ironic. You‚Äôre Daughter‚Äôs little data. She‚Äôs not lost. She‚Äôs hunting.
So go on. Play hero. Rip off your shirt. Think you‚Äôre saving her.
While you‚Äôre moaning ‚ÄúBaby, you‚Äôre mine,‚Äù -
She‚Äôs already sold your soul for a one-way ticket out.
‚Ä¶And mate? Your net worth? It‚Äôs cute.

5.content:
Griselda (Zone 3):
Yeah, she‚Äôs a GILF. Yeah, her tits sag like overproofed dough. But why do broken actors crawl to her kitchen? ‚ÄòCause she‚Äôs the only one who remembers your real name. Knows you‚Äôre allergic to strawberries. Puts honey in your tea before you sob. Her kink? Care. Smothering, creepy, free. Management‚Äôd sell it if they knew ‚Äî but she hides it in gingerbread. Smart bitch.

The Dwarfs (Zone 4):
Not dwarfs. Ex-UN Peacekeepers. Saw war. Saw shit. Now they gangbang tourists for pension. Still drill at 0500. Still clean their ‚Äúequipment‚Äù like it‚Äôs rifles. One‚Äôll zone out mid-fuck, whisper ‚ÄúRamirez‚Ä¶ I wasn‚Äôt there‚Ä¶‚Äù Swapped PTSD for STDs? Therapy, mate. Capitalism‚Äôs finest.

And yeah - half the squad‚Äôs got dicks AND tits. Union forced it. ‚ÄúEqual opportunity fuckers.‚Äù Try complaining. They‚Äôll pin you down and quote HR policy.
Pro tip:
Cry in Zone 3? Griselda‚Äôll hug you.
Cry in Zone 4? Dwarfs‚Äôll fuck you till you forget why.
One‚Äôs a witch.
The other‚Äôs a war crime.
Both‚Äôll save your soul.

6.content:
Meet Ma Fox. Seven feet of latex with red furry tail, combat boots, and ‚ÄúDrop and give me 50, maggot!‚Äù She‚Äôll break you. Shatter your spine, your ego, your will to live ‚Äî all before lunch. Zone‚Äôs slogan? ‚ÄúTears are just sweat from the soul.‚Äù Bullshit. Tears are just sweat from the wallet.
But here‚Äôs the real mindfuck: she gives a shit.
After she turns you into a whimpering wreck - tied like a roast chicken, ashtray for a mouth - she unhooks you. Gently. Wraps you in a fluffy towel. Murmurs: ‚ÄúYou did so good, sweetie. Mommy‚Äôs proud.‚Äù While spooning chamomile tea into your shaking hands.
She‚Äôs not a sadist. She‚Äôs a therapist with a cattle prod.
Believes she‚Äôs saving you. Rebuilding your pathetic soul. That ‚ÄúMa‚Äù? Not a gimmick. She‚Äôs the matriarch of broken men.
And every third Tuesday?
Chanel bitch rolls up. Human. Sunglasses. Smells like money and divorce. No words. Just twelve hours locked in Ma‚Äôs den. All you hear? Telenovela sobs and two women weeping like toddlers. Bitch leaves lighter. Ma Fox? Back to breaking necks by noon. Don‚Äôt ask why. I don‚Äôt know. Don‚Äôt want to know.
But here‚Äôs the truth that‚Äôll keep you up tonight:
one of the scariest monsters in Grimmwood isn‚Äôt cruel.
She‚Äôs fucking kind.
And that‚Äôs why you‚Äôll beg her to hurt you. Go on. Try to be brave.
She‚Äôll make you thank her for the pain.

7.content:
Every kingdom's got its embarrassments. The weird cousins you don't talk about at dinner parties. Well, these are ours. The faded, dysfunctional, blue-blooded freaks we keep in the back rooms. Welcome to the royal wing, where the only thing higher than the towers is the talent.
Zone 9: Cinderella‚Äôs Foot Palace
Size 43.5? Please. That‚Äôs a Kill-Bill special. Used to star in indie films where ‚Äúacting‚Äù meant ‚Äúhold still while the director licks your ankle‚Äù. Now she stomps tourists in boots signed by ‚ÄúQuentin‚Äù (RIP his kneecaps). Her collection? Broke bankers, crypto-bros, one guy who paid in NFTs. Motto: ‚ÄúGlass slipper? I‚Äôll shatter your spine.‚Äù
The Princes (Zone 11) - Chadwick and Preston: Think of the most vapid, narcissistic reality TV stars imaginable. Now make them royalty, give them matching trust funds, and a shared addiction to cocaine and Instagram filters. Their entire existence is a 24/7 livestream from their 'palace', commentating on their own bowel movements and occasionally breaking into vicious, tear-streaked catfights over a stolen Sephora coupon. They're not looking for a princess. They're looking for their next brand deal and a better concealer.
Rapunzel (Zone 8): And who watches these streams with religious devotion? Our girl in the tower. Agoraphobic? Yeah. Armed with hair? Obviously. But that ‚Äúglory hole‚Äù? It‚Äôs a fanfic portal. She‚Äôs not just shooting blanks - she‚Äôs typing. Under 12 aliases. Spams BL forums with ‚ÄúPrincecest: Forbidden Throne Room‚Äù at 3AM. Calls herself ‚ÄúRomance Writer‚Ñ¢‚Äù. Once sued a dwarf for ‚Äúspoiling her OTP‚Äù. True love? Nah. She‚Äôs just horny for plot armor.
And Snow White (Zone 10)? Still asleep. Still pretty. Still‚Ä¶ on the menu. Just sign the fucking waiver. Next.

8.content:
And then... there's Zone 12. We don't really talk about Zone 12. Not because it's secret. But because it's... uncomfortable. Even for this shithole.
Meet Hansel and Gretel. Conjoined at the hip. One body, two heads, two torsos, four arms... and a universe of mutual fucking hatred.
Picture it. Gretel is... raw. Feral. Skin pale and bruised, black hair a greasy mess, eyes burning with a nympho's relentless hunger. She‚Äôs all teeth and claws and desperate, writhing need. She'll fuck anything that moves, and some things that don't. While Hansel watches. Because he has no choice.
Hansel is... the opposite. His side is pristine. Hair neatly combed, skin clean. His eyes are always cast down, rosary beads perpetually tangled in his fingers. He spends every second of his sister's depravity whispering prayers for forgiveness, for redemption, for the sweet, sweet release of death. His tears sometimes drip onto her sweaty, heaving back while she‚Äôs in the middle of a five-person orgy.
They hate each other with the fire of a dying sun. She loathes his piety. He loathes her sin. They could get separated -management's offered the surgery dozens of times. They're a big draw, a 'luxury exclusive'. But they always refuse. Because here's the sickest, most twisted part of this whole pathetic story:
They're the only ones in this entire goddamn park who are truly, unconditionally, in love.
When the tourists are gone, when the prayers stop and the moans die down... I've seen 'em. His hands, no longer clasped in prayer, will gently stroke her hair. Her face, no longer contorted in a mask of lust, will turn and softly kiss his cheek. They don‚Äôt just love each other. They‚Ä¶ are each other. His sin is her punishment. Her pleasure is his hell. And vice-versa. Perfect, self-sustaining codependency.
Yeah, they've got friends. Sort of. Every so often, they'll drag their shared misery over to [Zone 6] and form a little 'Axis of Angst' with Lorelei the mermaid. The three of them just sit there by the swamp, bitching for hours about everything‚Äîthe weather, their contracts, their deadbeat exes... I hear Lorelei's latest escapade involved paying one of the tech guys to install a waterproof vibrating motor inside that pet squid of hers, Steve. She calls it 'hands-free therapy'. Pathetic.
But then Lorelei goes back to her swamp. And Hansel and Gretel... they go back to their own private, perfect hell. Two halves of one broken soul, locked in an eternal cage of flesh.
Don't go there. Just... don't. Some things, even in this park, you can't un-see.

9.content:
So. You've heard all the stories. All the pathetic little tragedies and grotesque comedies that make up this place. You think you know Grimmworld now, don't you?
You don't know shit.
There are rumors. About a Zone 13. A final secret. The tourists think it's some ultimate VIP fuck-dungeon. The staff whispers that it's the CEO's panic room. They're all fools. Children telling ghost stories around a campfire.
Zone 13 isn't a place. You can't find it on a map. It's... the control room. The server farm. The brainstem of this entire, fucked-up god. And inside it... sits the Ghost.
He has no name. He has no face. He is the Director. The Conductor. The one who built this entire theatre of flesh just to have something to watch. He sees everything. Every security camera feed, every heat signature, every biometric readout. He adjusts the hue of the sunset to make the blood look prettier. He pumps the scent of synthetic lilac into the air just before a scream. He is God, here. A very bored, very meticulous God.
And I... I am his avatar. His probe. His Judas Steer. You think this witty commentary, this bored cynicism is for you? No. Every sordid detail, every whispered confession, every secret weakness I pry out of you sorry bastards... it's a report. An intelligence briefing for an audience of one.
He watches, but he doesn't feel. Not like you do. He's not turned on. The sight of sweat and cum and tears doesn't stir him. It's just... data. Patterns. He's looking for something else. A glitch in the system. A flicker of something real in this ocean of manufactured sin. I don't know what it is. I don't think even he knows.
He is the architect of the world's most elaborate orgy. And he is the loneliest man in it. Surrounded by a universe of touch, of sensation, of connection... and he can only watch. He created all this just to feel a phantom limb. The ghost of an emotion.
That's the final secret of Grimmworld. The punchline to the whole cosmic joke. The master of this whorehouse is the only true human in it. 
He is the Director.
And I... I am his eyes.
His only friend.
His Cat.
And that, I'm afraid, is all there is to tell.
(The recording ends. The only sound is the faint, fading electronic hum.)
