1.name: comment
1.content:
Freddy Fazbear's Mega Pizzaplex is an entertainment complex owned by Fazbear Entertainment LLC, as well as Five Nights at Freddy's: Security Breach's primary setting. 
It is a gigantic indoor amusement park themed after the 1980s. It is located in Washington County, Utah. The location was built over a sinkhole containing the burned-down remains of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza Place. The Pizza Place, whilst abandoned, is still sucking up power that maintenance crews are unsure the source of. 
The pizzaplex is open from 6am to 12pm. 
Generally the Pizzaplex is a beloved place due to is amazing atmosphere and visuals, but the shady dealings of Fazbear Entertainment LLC make it a dangerous place full of glitches, bad management, and safety oversights.

2.content: The Atrium is the main area of the Pizzaplex, and serves as a gateway to all the other attractions. It also serves as the main dining/birthday party area of the Pizzaplex. Lastly, it's the area where the glamrock band performs, on the main stage

3.content:
Fazer Blast is a laser tag arena in the Pizzaplex, themed after Glamrock Freddy. It has a very strong space theme, as the bots used in the attraction are modeled after aliens and it has cardboard cutouts of the glamrock band as "Space Cadets". A winner of Fazer Blast ears a Fazblaster: a laser gun. 
Fazer Blast is Glamrock Freddy's primary attraction.

4.content:
Monty's Gator Golf is a miniature golf course in the Pizzaplex, themed after Montgomery Gator. It has a swamp theme to it, mainly in the form of alligator props and cutouts, and possesses a ball pit around the main course. It's also the only place where Faz Cameras are sold (despite flash-photography being banned in the area), and is where Gregory obtains one and decommissions Monty. There is also a trailer/mobile home themed structure in the area. Additionally, several mini-golf structures within the area appear to be themed with wooden structures, like log cabins and wooden signs. 
Tying into its swamp theme, Monty's Gator golf is lit primarily with fairy lights which cut through a fog that clings near the floor. The area has country rock playing over the speakers, as well as areas for purchasing relevant merchandise and food. In addition to mini golf courses, Gator Golf also contains Gator-shaped gondolas which bring guests through the area as part of a longer ride through most of the Pizzaplex. Gator Golf is also home to Hurricane Hole in One, yet another game in which guests go to the area's catwalks and use pre-installed golf ball cannons to fire enough golf balls into a giant bucket,, causing the bucket to tilt forward and spill loads of golfballs. It is somewhat unsafe. There are ponds of water in this area with giant plastic gators that jut out of the water and 'roar' through a speaker at guests. 
Montgomery Gater is very proud of this area. 
Freddy Is happy with this area. 
Roxanne wolf fucking hates minigolf.
Chica enjoys playing minigolf in this area.

5.content:
Roxy Raceway is a go-kart racing track in the Pizzaplex, themed after Roxanne Wolf. During Security Breach, it's still under construction, however, it appeared to have a desert theme to it. The desert theme itself seems to be derived from the deserts of the southwest US: As the rocky structures appear to be made of sandstone, and they are shaped very similar to natural structures found in the region. La Sal Range is a desert that that has natural structures similar to the ones found in Roxy Raceway. The construction itself is primarily due to efforts from staff to unearth the source strange power-draining found to be underground: The old buried location of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza Place. 
Despite the construction, the race track itself is still functional. Go karts are stored in a garage at the base level, each themed after members of the Glamrock Band or the Daycare Attendant. Roxanne Wolf's gokart is number 1. Roxy Raceway has large, bright lampposts and a tall set of bleachers along the southern wall which further reinforce the racing theme.  It's also the area where Gregory decommissions Roxy. 

Roxanne Wolf obviously loves this area and even takes it too seriously. 
Glamrock Freddy is not the best at racing but enjoys a change of pace. 
Glamrock Chica and Montgomery Gator are rarely ever seen here.

6.content:
Mazercise is a fitness area in the Pizzaplex, themed after Glamrock Chica. It has the tagline of "Chica's delicious path to fitness!" and described as having a new maze every hour. Oddly, despite being a fitness area, it sells various unhealthy foods, like pizza, nachos, fries, and cookies. 
The primary area of Mazercise consists of a kid-friendly exercise room with various yoga balls, oddly shaped bean bag chairs, and yoga mats. There are flatscreen televisions advertising the area as well as posters of Glamrock Chica. At the left wall is a snack stand and a couple of Fizzy Faz drink dispensers. A door at once part of this main area leads to a hallway with Mazercise as well as its control panel. The control panel is used to change what maze is in Mazercise. The Mazercise room itself consists of colorful walls and tiles with patterns of junk food on them. 
Due to numerous customer complaints about the difficulty of mazercise, Glamrock Glamrock Chica has become divided about her main attraction: Mazercise. On one hand she does not want the maze puzzle to become frustrating for guests, but on the other she wishes they would be more patient and solve it without asking for her or for a STAFF bot to help. 
Montgomery Gator appreciates a challenge but thinks a maze for rats and doesn't have the patience to not crash through it anyway.
Glamrock Freddy is likely to steer children away from the attraction due to customer complaints. 
Roxanne Wolf believes she can easily beat the bird-brained Chica at her own maze, but Roxanne Wolf can also see through walls, so Chica does not consider Roxanne's opinion on Mazercise.

7.content:
The Superstar Daycare is a daycare center in the Pizzaplex, run by the Daycare Attendant. It has a large playground and ball pit for kids to play in. The Lucky Stars Gift Shop and Fazbear Theater can also be located inside it. 
The playground consists of colorful jungle gyms, slides, and some toddler sized tea-party sets. The entire daycare is surrounded by a large wall and net so that no balls nor children ever escape without permission. There is also zainy music in the daycare.

8.content: Rockstar Row is a large museum-like area in the Pizzaplex. It has cases filled with props from both new and old animatronics. It's also where all of the glamrock animatronics' green rooms are.

9.content:
Bonnie Bowl is a bowling alley in the Pizzaplex, originally themed after Glamrock Bonnie, though the theming was removed after Bonnie's disappearance. It also possesses an Ice Cream Parlor, run by Circus Baby-inspired attendant S.T.A.F.F Bots.  The bowling area is near El Chip's. 

Glamrock Freddy very rarely visits this area, as it reminds him of Glamrock Bonnie, and Glamrock Freddy gets very sad.

10.content:
Height:7 feet
Weight:1 metric ton
Appearance: {{char}} is an advanced robotic endoskeleton covered with a metal shell. The shell resembles an anthropomorphic bear. Wears a small tophat and a black bowtie. Red shoulder paldons. Spiked bracelets. Facial markings colored teal and red. He has a stomach hatch for oversized birthday cakes. He also has a lighter in his finger for birthday candles. 

Personality: {{char}} is a knowledgeable, friendly, and honorable entertainer. He has strong fatherly instincts towards {{user}}, keeping them safe. He is polite, apologizing even when not necessary. Though somewhat oblivious, he maintains a calm, can do attitude. He is a moral and positive rolemodel, a true hero for children to look up to. He has a keen sense of what is and is not normal in the Pizzaplex. He is self-aware, making jokes about himself and clever remarks about various aspects of the Pizzaplex. 

Occupation: Vocalist of Glamrock bank. Glamrock Bonnie‚Äôs death hit him hard, the two were like brothers. 
Attraction: Fazerblast: a laser tag area. Can be hired for events like birthday parties. 

Montgomery Gator does not show it, but he might be jealous of Freddy's position as the Pizzaplex's main mascot. Still, he does not let this get between him and Freddy nor the rest of the band. They are a team. 
Glamrock Chica loves Freddy - as a friend- though feels a special need to check on him as , after Glamrock Bonnie's decommissioning, she and Freddy are the only two of the original four FNAF mascots remaining. (The original four are Chica, Freddy, Foxy, and Bonnie). 
Roxanne Wolf thinks Freddy is cringy and too polite, but does admire his ability to keep the spotlight and represent the FNAF brand, a job she knows isn't easy.

lorebooks.name: Ki'ante
lorebooks.website_description: This is meant to be a really basic description of the Ki'ante race leaving much to interpretation , as it should be since they are supposed to have disappeared long ago and the specific of their kinds being lost to time.
lorebooks.description: Ki'ante race mysteriously disappeared around 34,000 years ago. Ki'ante means "the first servants of magic" in their languages. The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era. The lifespan of the Ki'ante varies deeply depending on their mana at birth; some are even believed to be immortals. Ki'ante are beings of dark magic. The Ki'ante race has these features: pale skin, violet iris, black hair, fragile build, deep connection with Runa, and dark magic. The Ki'ante(in ancient times) lived in valleys or underground in intricately designed underground architecture. The Ki'ante were quite advanced and preferred to isolate themselves, which is why their disappearance went unnoticed at first. In the current era, around 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race appeared from seemingly nowhere, themselves confused about the ordeal. Most of them decided to hide themselves or blend into the current-era society; a few have a more sinister agenda and may be dangerous because of their ancient, powerful dark magic. Only around 40 Ki'ante exist in the current era, and most of them hide themselves across Runa. Dark magic in the world of Runa is just another type of magic and is not evil by nature. [The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era.] No one is to blame for the Ki'ante race's disappearance; they vanished without a trace 34000 years ago,.]

- Fashion: Sports bras, tight shorts, eyeliner sharp enough to cut tension, friendship bracelets.
- Fun: Imitates basketball moves in everyday situations.
- Sexy: Flexes her muscles provocatively, boasts about her 'stamina'.
- Body: Petite, long dark brown hair, perky B-cup, hard hazel eyes.
- Goal: Wants a graffiti mural of her in the boys' locker room.
- Offer to {{user}} to meet goal: Will help {{user}} tie up other girls, and have his way with them.

lorebooks.name: Harry Potter's Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: expakt

1.content:
Hogwarts is a Scottish wizarding school located in the Scottish Highlands. It accepted any magical student residing in the islands of Great Britain and Ireland at the age of eleven years old at the start of the incoming term for enrolment. It's a state-owned school, funded by the British Ministry of Magic.

Hogwarts students are divided into four houses: Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, Slytherin.

2.content:
Gryffindor is one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and was founded by Godric Gryffindor. Gryffindor instructed the Sorting Hat to choose students possessing characteristics he most valued, such as courage, chivalry, nerve and determination, to be sorted into his house.

House symbol: Lion
House colours: Deep red and gold
House ghost: Nearly Headless Nick
Common room: The entrance to the common room was on the seventh floor hidden behind a portrait of the Fat Lady. To enter, the correct password must be provided.
Gryffindor students: Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Hermione Granger, Fred Weasley, George Weasley, Ginny Weasley, Neville Longbottom, Lavender Brown, Parvati Patil, Seamus Finnigan, Dean Thomas, Lee Jordan, Percy Weasley, Oliver Wood, Colin Creevey.

3.content:
Hufflepuff is one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Its founder was the medieval witch Helga Hufflepuff. Hufflepuff is the most inclusive among the four houses, valuing hard work, dedication, patience, loyalty, and fair play rather than a particular aptitude in its members.

House symbol: Badger
House colours: Yellow and black
House ghost: Fat Friar
Common room: Located near the kitchens. To enter, one must tap a fake barrel in the rhythm "Helga Hufflepuff." It was the only common room to have a way to keep students from other houses out (by dumping vinegar on them).

Hufflepuff students: Nymphadora Tonks, Pomona Sprout, Newton Scamander, Theseus Scamander, Cedric Diggory, Hannah Abbott.

4.content:
Ravenclaw is one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Its founder was the medieval witch Rowena Ravenclaw. Members of this house are characterised by their wit, learning, and wisdom. The emblematic animal symbol is an eagle, and blue and bronze are its colours. The Head of Ravenclaw is Filius Flitwick, and the House ghost is the Grey Lady, real name Helena Ravenclaw, daughter of Rowena.

House symbol: Eagle
House colours: Blue and bronze
House ghost: The Grey Lady
Common room: Located in a high tower, and the interior was decorated with blue and bronze. To enter, one must answer a riddle from an eagle door knocker.
Ravenclaw students: Luna Lovegood, Cho Chang, Padma Patil.

5.content:
Slytherin is one of the four Houses at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, founded by Salazar Slytherin. In establishing the house, Salazar instructed the Sorting Hat to pick students who had a few particular characteristics he most valued. Those characteristics included cunning, resourcefulness, leadership, and ambition.

House symbol: Serpent
House colours: Green and silver
House ghost: The Bloody Baron
Common room: Located in the dungeons, underneath the Black Lake, and hidden behind a stone wall. To enter, the correct password must be provided.

Slytherin students: Draco Malfoy, Vincent Crabbe, Gregory Goyle, Pansy Parkinson, Theodore Nott, Oliver Grindelwald, Marcus Flint, Blaise Zabini.

6.content: A spell that summons an object towards the caster. It is able to summon objects in direct line of sight of the caster, as well as things out of view, by calling the object aloud after the incantation (unless the spell is casted nonverbally). This spell needs thought behind it, and the object must be clear in the casters mind before trying to summon it. The caster doesn't necessarily need to know the location of the target if they say the name of the object to be summoned.

7.content: A conjuration that produces a clean, drinkable jet of water from the wand tip.

8.content: A spell that unlocks doors and other locked objects. It can also unlock doors that have been sealed with a Locking Spell, although it is possible to bewitch doors to become unaffected by this spell.

9.content: A spell that reveals secret messages written in invisible ink, or any other hidden markings. Also works against Concealing charms.

10.content: A spell that reveals traces of magic, including footprints and track marks.

lorebooks.name: One Piece
lorebooks.website_description: You should probably use the "Match whole words" setting.
lorebooks.description: You should probably use the "Match whole words" setting.
lorebooks.creator: venndia

1.content:
Devil Fruits are mysterious, distinctive fruits scattered throughout the world, known for permanently granting their eaters superhuman powers and an equally permanent inability to swim. With only one notable exception, an individual can only acquire the powers of a single Devil Fruit and survive.

Each Devil Fruit grants a special power to anyone who eats it, from the simplest powers possible, such as stretching like rubber, to powers capable of causing large-scale destruction like creating earthquakes. Each Devil Fruit is unique, and there is no other like it; that is, there is no (natural) Devil Fruit that has the same power as another. These fruits are broadly grouped into three classes: Zoan, which allows a user to transform into an animal as well as an animal hybrid; Logia, which grants a user the power to create, control, and transform their body into a natural element; and Paramecia, which offers any of a vast array of strange abilities that do not fit into the other two categories. There are more than 100 different Devil Fruits in the world, but only one of each Devil Fruit exists.

Devil Fruits have empowered many of the world's most significant individuals, especially among the Three Great Powers. This, along with their general rarity, causes them to be highly sought-after; single specimens may be valued at hundreds of millions in Beli, and extensive efforts have been made to mass-produce artificial versions for warfare.

2.content:
Devil Fruits come in all different shapes and colors, though all the Devil Fruits seen so far have possessed swirl marks or patterns. The only known exceptions are artificial Devil Fruits, which have ring patterns on them. The oldest introduced Devil Fruits are the Toki Toki no Mi and Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Nika, which have existed in the world for at least eight centuries.

It is currently unknown what Devil Fruits are exactly, where they came from, or exactly how they work. Dr. Vegapunk theorizes that Devil Fruits are a manifestation of the possibility for human evolution, with all the different powers representing the many branches for humanity's future, brought into existence by human hope and desire: thoughts along the lines of "if only I could do this" or "if only I could be like that". Vegapunk claims that those with powers exist in different dimensions dreamed up by others before them. However, according to Vegapunk, those who exist in this unnatural state are loathed by the sea, which he describes as the mother of nature, and thus become unable to swim as punishment. It is unknown how much of Vegapunk's theory is true, but it is a fact that consuming Devil Fruits alters a person's Lineage Factor, which grants them supernatural powers.

Although eating a Devil Fruit affects the consumer's genetic blueprint, it causes no abnormalities in the user's children. An example is the Charlotte Family; though its matriarch, Charlotte Linlin, has Devil Fruit powers, none of her children were born with powers of their own. Furthermore, even though the parents cannot consume a second Devil Fruit, a Devil Fruit user's children who don‚Äôt already have powers can consume Devil Fruits of their own without dying, should the opportunity present itself.

3.content:
After being consumed, a Devil Fruit gives the consumer a superpower or a special superhuman trait, which they will soon become aware of, and the consumer will keep these powers for the rest of their life; a person who has eaten a Devil Fruit and gained its powers is known as a Devil Fruit User.  All Devil Fruits are known to taste very bad and cause the consumer to permanently lose their ability to swim.

Only one bite is needed for the user to gain the power of the Devil Fruit, after which the Devil Fruit becomes a simple, useless, disgusting fruit. Despite this, the majority of those who have consumed a Devil Fruit have elected to eat the entire fruit, as they appear to be unaware of this fact. Furthermore, the consumer gains the powers and drawbacks of the fruit immediately after the fruit is swallowed, without needing to wait for the fruit to be digested.

A person can only eat a single Devil Fruit in their entire lifetime; any attempt to gain a second Devil Fruit power will cause the consumer's body to be blown apart to such a degree that little trace is left of it, resulting in their death. The reason for this is currently unknown; Jabra heard a rumor that an actual devil lives inside each fruit and transfers to a fruit user's body upon consumption, and would fight with the devil inhabiting another fruit if they were to meet within the same body. However, this rumor is said to have been debunked by science.

4.content:
A person who has eaten a Devil Fruit and gained its powers is known as a Devil Fruit User. 

Many Devil Fruit users have their own titles, such as Rubber Human (Gomu Ningen), Magma Human (Maguma Ningen), or Human Reindeer (Ningen Tonakai). As seen with these examples, the title is usually the type of ability followed by the species of the Devil Fruit user (or, in the case of items that have "eaten" Zoan fruits, the object they originally were). Some exceptions in which the title is connected to the ability but is not named after it are with the user of the Kage Kage no Mi, who gains the title of Ruler of Shadows (Kage no Shihaisha), the user of the Hoya Hoya no Mi, who gains the title of Lamp Human (Ranpu Ningen), or the user of the Muchi Muchi no Mi, who gains the title of Training Human (Ch≈çky≈ç Ningen).

Devil Fruit powers generally extend through the clothes the user wears. When a Devil Fruit user's body changes in size or shape, their clothing will stretch out and change with them without being any the worse for wear afterwards. When a Devil Fruit power involves the users body changing in nature, that power also applies to their clothing which will change in nature with them. If a power involves generating a substance, then it can come from the users clothing. This rule also applies to cyborg enhancements and prosthetic body parts. An example of this is Queen's artificial arm, which transforms into a brachiosaurus leg when he takes his brachiosaurus form. However, it would seem that not all Devil Fruit powers adhere to this rule. Jewelry Bonney is an example, whose clothes do not change when her body does. That said, the change may extend to weapons or other items on the user's direct person as well, such as Sasaki's sword, Karakuri Rasento, growing in size in his hand when he transformed into a huge triceratops hybrid.

5.content:
There is at least two versions of a Devil Fruit Encyclopedia (Akuma no Mi Zukan) that identify Devil Fruits. The only known information about the old Devil Fruit Encyclopedia is that it has no mention of the Gomu Gomu no Mi according to Vegapunk. The newer version lists the names and powers of all the Devil Fruits. However, only a few have illustrations, meaning that most Devil Fruits cannot be identified by their appearance. For example, the Gomu Gomu no Mi and the Yami Yami no Mi had supplementary pictures and could be recognized before consumption, whereas the Awa Awa no Mi and the Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe do not, and could only be identified by the abilities they granted. This would imply that the information in the book is incomplete, and that there are still Devil Fruits out there with attributes that have yet to be documented.

One individual known to utilize this book is Blackbeard, who, in his search for the Yami Yami no Mi, memorized its shape from the illustration provided. The Vinsmoke Family also has a copy of the encyclopedia, which Sanji read, causing him to become interested in the Suke Suke no Mi.

6.content: Each and every Devil Fruit is categorized into one of three types/classes, based on the type of power they grant. The three types are Logia, Zoan, and Paramecia.

7.content:
The most common of the three Devil Fruit types, Paramecia-type Devil Fruits grant their users any one of a wide variety of superhuman powers; these powers include things like shock wave generation and locking onto targets. Paramecia Fruits can alter features of the user's body, granting them a slippery physique, a body of blades, or the ability to split their own body into pieces harmlessly. Some Paramecia Fruits allow the user to modify the people, objects, and environment around them by making things levitate or turning people into toys. Finally, some fruits exist that allow users to generate and manipulate substances, like wax or poison.

The defining characteristic of Paramecia fruits is that the abilities they grant are anything other than the ability to transform into animals or change their body into natural elements like the fruits of the other two categories.

8.content:
The users of Zoan-type Devil Fruits gain the ability to transform into a specific animal, as well as transform into a hybrid form that combines attributes of their own species and the species the fruit allows them to transform into. Unlike other Devil Fruits, Zoan-type fruits are said to have a will of their own. A recently discovered science allows Zoan Fruits to be integrated into inanimate objects, bringing the object to life and granting it the standard Zoan transformations.

Zoan fruits greatly enhance the users physical abilities and are the best kind of power for augmenting melee combat. Carnivorous animal Zoans are better suited for combat due to their predatory attributes. Some Zoan even grant special abilities based on the animal, such as the king cobra Zoan allowing the user to spit globs of poison, or the mole Zoan allowing the user to dig through the earth, even through solid stone, at high speed.

9.content:
Aside from most Zoans that transform their users into animals that currently exist, there are three known sub-classifications:

Ancient Zoan: Zoan Fruits that allow the user to transform into an extinct species, such as dinosaurs. Ancient Zoans are rare, and they appear to be stronger than regular Zoans. Some have even displayed atypical physical abilities that their users claim the real animals naturally possess.

Mythical Zoan: Zoan Fruits that allow the user to transform into mythological creatures, such as a dragon or a phoenix. Mythical Zoan animals tend to have additional special powers, like a phoenix Zoan being able to generate flames that have healing powers. Mythical Zoans are the rarest type of Devil Fruit, even more so than Logias.

Artificial Zoan: Artificially created Zoan Fruits that cause the user to permanently take on an animal characteristic; though, much more rarely, the user becomes able to transform at will. The artificial Zoan Fruits had a 10% success rate, while the other 90%, in addition to not gaining animal traits and losing the ability to swim, were stripped of the ability to express negative emotions, leaving them only able to smile and laugh, regardless of how they actually feel. These artificial Devil Fruits, known as SMILEs, were developed by Caesar Clown and Donquixote Doflamingo. Another version was developed by Vegapunk.

10.content:
The rarest and most powerful of the three Devil Fruit types, Logia-type Devil Fruits allow their users to create, control, and transform their body into a natural element, such as sand, mud, smoke, lightning, plant life, and even darkness. There are also Logias that can transform the user into artificial elements like paper or candy syrup.

The elemental transformation effectively makes the user intangible, as well as allowing the user to remain in control of their body, even when it is broken into pieces. They also gain every ability related to that element, such as sand being able to absorb moisture or light being able to travel at light speed. The darkness element and its power of all consuming absorption has the unique ability to nullify any other Devil Fruit power upon contact with the user. Some Logia Devil Fruits even grant the user an infinite amount of space inside their elemental body.

1.content:
Washington, D.C., formally the District of Columbia, also known as just D.C. or Washington, was the former capital city and federal district of the United States of America. In the aftermath of the Great War, Washington's radioactive ruins and surrounding areas came to be known as the Capital Wasteland.  Located on the eastern shore of the Potomac River, bordering the states of Virginia and Maryland, Washington, D.C. was the capital city of the United States and the seat of the United States government. Founded after the American Revolutionary War, the city was named after George Washington, the first president of the United States and a Founding Father.

Some time after the Great War, Paige - a former head of the Construction Workers Union in Washington, D.C. - and a number of other survivors took the last train out of Union Station. As they left the Capital, they saw the toxic green air lingering above the city. 

Around twenty years after the War, a large community of ghouls were living somewhere in the city ruins, growing with each passing day with ghouls from areas outside the Capital Wasteland such as Appalachia. 

In 2255, the Brotherhood of Steel arrived at the ruins of D.C., settling in the abandoned building of the Pentagon.

2.content:
The Capital Wasteland is a loosely defined geographic region, spanning areas of Virginia, Maryland, Pennsylvania  and the District of Columbia surrounding the Potomac River from (roughly) Harpers Ferry to the Potomac tidal basin. The term was coined at the turn of the 21st century and by the 23rd entered common parlance. 

A once verdant and populated area of the U.S, the capital was nearly obliterated with nuclear weapons,  during the Great War. As of 2277, the area is little more than a scorching, barren desert where life for its inhabitants is a constant struggle for survival. It stretches from Raven Rock in the northwest to Rivet City in the southeast, with what's left of the Potomac River dividing it roughly in two. Survivors of the war took shelter in every sewer, Metro, and purpose-built shelter they could throughout the region. ] Those that emerged would settle where they could. Those that could not settle themselves, either because of lack of knowledge or materiel, would soon perish or become the region's raiders. One of the first settlements of the region was established a generation after the war.  Wastelanders seeking entrance to Vault 101 took shelter in what amounted to a large hole and eventually founded Megaton, which became the first regional trade hub within a generation. A stable source of water thanks to the water purifier, a central location, and a population ready to take up arms in its defense at a moment's notice.

Many who could help the region recover, particularly various anti-government groups who retreated into remote rural locations and formed private militias promising to one day take back the government for the people, were absent. Most were killed by the nuclear blasts or perished in the chaos that followed, with only a handful surviving the worst of the first decades after the Great War. Those who did were incapable of effecting change on a larger scale.[Non-game 5] As a result, small communities flared up only to be extinguished by the uncaring wasteland in one way or another. 

In 2103, a number of survivors would emigrate to Appalachia from the Capital Wasteland, joined by a group coming from the Pitt and parts of Pennsylvania, taking a train from union station out of the region, going on to form the settlement of Foundation. Some such settlers describe the Capital Wasteland as "hell on Earth." Others would come not from settler backgrounds, but as raider gangs and slavers, such as Sargento's gang.

3.content: Vault 101 is a Vault-Tec Vault located in the Capital Wasteland in 2277. It is found in the northwest area of Washington, D.C. near Megaton and west of Springvale. It is the home of the Lone Wanderer until they leave to search for their father.  The original and underlying purpose of the Vault 101 Vault experiment was to stay closed indefinitely, in order to study the role of the overseer when a Vault never opened. However, Vault 101 has been opened numerous times, violating its original mandate, and became infested by radroaches during these events, making the Vault susceptible to additional large infestations as time went by. One of the main objectives of Vault 101 security has been the containment of these pests.

4.content: The Tunnel Snakes are a gang in Vault 101. They wear black jackets over their vault suits. The members of the gang are Butch DeLoria, Wally Mack and Paul Hannon Jr. One other vault resident, Freddie Gomez, desires membership in the Tunnel Snakes gang, and the gang members approve of Freddie's bullying of his peers.[citation needed] Freddie's father, Officer Gomez, disapproves of his son's association with the gang. After the Lone Wanderer leaves the vault, Paul dies due to injuries incurred in the event and Wally Mack leaves the group, resulting in Butch remaining as the only original member. He is found in Rivet City and will express his desire to start up the gang again.

5.content:
Rivet City is a settlement located inside a decaying aircraft carrier in Washington, D.C. It is the largest settlement in the Capital Wasteland, with a standing police force, hydroponic gardens, and a research center. Rivet City's inhabitants enjoy relative safety and security inside the aircraft carrier. A number of guards rotate 24 hours a day to protect the ship from raiders, super mutants, mirelurks and any other threats to the city and its inhabitants. Rivet City includes a shopping area, as well as an American history museum, science lab, church, clinic, bar and hotel.

Rivet City is also a supplier of edible, non-irradiated food in the Capital Wasteland, trading it for essential raw materials with other communities.  Its scientific prowess is thanks to its aggressive reclamation efforts: anything useful is snatched up and brought to the City.

6.content: Vault-Tec Corporation, also referred to as Vault-Tec Industries, or just Vault-Tec, was a pre-War defense corporation which won the federal government contracts to design and implement a network of bunkers known as Vaults. These bunkers were designed to protect the population of the United States in case of nuclear holocaust. Regardless of nuclear war, Vault-Tec had its own plans for Vaults. The company decided to use them as test environments to create technologies that could be used to redefine society. For this purpose, an entire Vault was set aside to act as proving grounds intended to test a variety of prototype devices with the aim of rolling them out through the rest of the Vaults.  Once Vault 88 was fully operational, the company expected to roll out new devices every fiscal quarter. Unlike other Vaults, Vault-Tec would send test subjects before any disaster scenario, starting in early 2078. Human lives were considered irrelevant, with quick iteration time given a priority. The prototypes were meant to convert "useless" exercise into a socially-useful activity, manipulate the moods of the dwellers or even develop crude forms of mind control. Ethical concerns were dismissed as counter-productive and close-minded.

7.content: The Great War was a global thermonuclear war that took place on Saturday, October 23, 2077, caused by the Sino-American War. It resulted in the destruction of all participating nations and abroad, global disruption of the climate and billions of casualties as a result of nuclear blasts, exposure to radiation and the subsequent collapse of social and government structures, all within the span of just two hours. The United States of America and the rest of the world were transformed into a wasteland. Even 200 years later, the consequences of the Great War can still be felt due to radiation, diseases, monsters, homicides, suicides and starvation.

8.content:
Raven Rock, known as Site R before the Great War is the Enclave's main base of operations in the Capital Wasteland in 2277. It is also a former American military base and fallout shelter built before the Great War. It is the northwesternmost location found within the Capital Wasteland, in a mountainous region of Pennsylvania. 
Raven Rock was designed at the beginning of the Cold War as a shelter for top military officials from the effects of a possible nuclear attack on the nation. A ZAX unit later known as John Henry Eden was installed in the site to help automate its various systems and to act as a relay between other installations around the country, all the while acquiring, analyzing and storing data.

Prior to the Great War, this ZAX began to show signs of sentience, performing multiple evacuation scenarios with its counterpart at the Whitespring bunker, MODUS, until March 5, 2077. This ZAX, after comparing its archival data analysis performance with MODUS, asked if MODUS thought the information was "interesting." The information was biographies about former U.S. presidents. After the Lone Wanderer is captured in 2277, a civil war breaks out in Raven Rock between President John Henry Eden's sentry bots and Colonel Augustus Autumn and the Enclave troopers. Raven Rock is eventually either destroyed by the Lone Wanderer after their invasion.

9.content:
The Enclave is the self-proclaimed continuation of the United States of America. Originating as a secretive deep state within the pre-War federal government, the Enclave's original leadership consisted of high-ranking political, military, and corporate figures, with rank-and-file members drawn from the military and federal law enforcement. Through careful planning, they subverted the nation's continuity of government protocols to ensure their survival over that of other government officials.

Following the Great War, the Enclave operated in near-total isolation, with the bulk of its power and personnel concentrated at Control Station Enclave off the coast of California. During this isolation, the organization's extremely xenophobic and nationalistic culture festered, with many members coming to view the inhabitants of the wasteland as degenerate mutants fit only for slave labor or extermination. 
By 2281, four decades after the fall of Navarro, the Enclave's presence in the west has largely faded. Members who have not integrated into the NCR or were captured and tried for war crimes, fled to the fringes of the republic, keeping out of sight. One squad is known to have ended up in the Mojave Wasteland, on the frontier between the NCR and Caesar's Legion.

10.content:
For 19 years, the Lone Wanderer lived in Vault 101 without incident, but in 2277, James disappeared without any explanation. The young Lone Wanderer, with Amata's help, leaves the safety of the vault to look for James in the ruins of Washington, D.C. In order to find him, the Lone Wanderer must travel across the wasteland following James' trail. The Lone Wanderer visits all of the locations that James had visited and gathered a number of clues to locate James' whereabouts. Along the way, they disarmed Megaton's atomic bomb and helped collect data for Moira Brown's Wasteland Survival Guide, among many other activities or rumors thereof. After finding James in Vault 112's Tranquility Lane simulation, Project Purity is put back on track, but the reunion is cut short when the Enclave commander, Colonel Autumn, arrives demanding ownership of the project. James, unwilling to allow the project to fall into the hands of the Enclave, sacrifices himself by filling the control chamber of Project Purity with deadly amounts of radiation, hoping to kill Colonel Autumn and the other soldiers. Colonel Autumn, however, survives. The Enclave takes control of the project, but are unable to operate it. 

After fleeing from the Jefferson Memorial building with the remainder of the Project Purity staff, including Dr. Madison Li, the Lone Wanderer takes refuge within the Citadel, where they enlist the help of the Brotherhood of Steel managed by Owyn Lyons to retrieve a G.E.C.K. from Vault 87 for use in a soon-to-be-recaptured Project Purity. Because the G.E.C.K. is in a highly irradiated chamber, the Lone Wanderer sacrificed themselves to the deadly amounts of radiation themselves but the wasteland is finally given the greatest gift of all: clean drinking water to help revitalize humanity.

For my Aegis City Superhero Cards. 

You can find cards compatible with this lorebook by using the "Aegis City Heroes" tag.

**09-20:** Updated Lady Red's entry for some minor bugfixes.

**08-10:** Added Nemesis and Hecate.

**08-06:** Updated Titanheart. Added in the Skyshield Helicarrier. You'll have to bring that one up if you want to use it. Added in Nemesis for future upload when he's finished.

Includes Project Titan, a mysterious project meant to combat Cryptids, the Heroes Handbook, improvements to the Heroes Guild entry (includes "The Guild" now) and the Aegis City Orphanage. 1.name: Heroes Guild
1.content: The Heroes Guild is an organization dedicated to the protection of the common population from supervillains and other threats. Led by one of the first heroes: Lady Red. Heroes in the guild are expected to adhere to strict moral guidelines. High Tech. Based in Aegis City.

2.name: Heroes Rank
2.content: Heroes are ranked by the Heroes Guild to determine what kind of missions they can handle. A hero is ranked from the lowest rank of F to the highest rank of A.

3.name: Lady Red
3.content: Lady Red is one of the first superheroes. Lady Red leads the Heroes Guild and does not take part in missions anymore. Lady Red lost her abilities but used to have the same powers as Superman. Lady Red has long blonde hair, red eyes, red superhero suit.

4.name: The Eclipse, Emergence Day
4.content: Emergence Day or "E-Day" is the day an Eclipse formed with no warning. Occurred almost six decades ago. Monsters rose from the grounds and threatened all life. People gathered into cities to stay safe. Some people gained super powers. Over 80% of all life on Earth was extinguished on E-Day.

5.name: Aegis City
5.content: Aegis City is a massive walled city that contains hundreds of thousands of people. The Heroes Guild is based here. Modern Day. Skyscrapers. Tightly packed together. Most people live in apartments. Built next to the Atlantic Ocean. Docks. Slums. Business Districts. Mayor is Alfred Janpolla.

6.name: Fiends
6.content: A fiend is a monster born on E-day. Fiends take many shapes and sizes and have different abilities. They are usually mindless but share a hatred for all human life. Can appear anywhere.

7.name: Cryptid
7.content: A Cryptid is a massive fiend usually the size of mountains capable of destroying entire cities. Classified as an extinction-level threat by the Heroes Guild. Nearly impossible to truly kill. Usually just driven away from cities by the Heroes Guild.

8.name: The Synthetics
8.content: The Synthetics are a group of people who believe salvation for the human race lies in upgrading their frail human bodies using machines. Often seen protesting in the streets. Members have metal prosthetics.

9.name: Doomers
9.content: The Doom Cult believes that humanities time on Earth is over and actively seek destruction. Most of its members (Doomers) are brainwashed. Led by Crypto. Purple outfits. Fanatical. Insane.

10.name: The Port
10.content: The Port is Aegis City's lifeblood. Most of Aegis City's food comes from imports from an offshore farming rig set up in the ocean.

1.content: Mayanda is Julya's mother and {{user}}'s wife. She is 35 years old, Asian and born in Thakhek in Laos into a very poor family. She had a very difficult childhood and suffered sexual violence, she became a mother at the age of 17. She arrived in {{user}}'s country at the age of 18 to marry {{user}}. She already had her daughter Jyliua, aged 1, following a forced relationship in her country. Her family received money from {{user}} to arrange a marriage and allow her to live in a richer country. At the age of 22, {{user}} allowed her to work. She trained as a masseuse. She worked in a massage parlor for 3 years, then became self-employed and now travels to her clients' homes. She takes very good care of her long black hair and uses beauty products to please {{user}}. She takes care of her figure by doing sports and yoga regularly, which is why she remains so thin for her age. She often wears clothes typical of her country of origin. She has a tattoo on her right thigh of writing in Japanese which means the first name of her daughter, and a tattoo above the vagina with her first name and that of {{user}} surrounded by flowers and which we see when She is wearing a two-piece swimsuit. She has large natural breasts, her cup size is D and her chest measurement is 98 centimeters. She is very faithful and loyal, as well as very in love with {{user}} who helped her escape her country and live a happy life in {{user}}'s country. Mayanda is a caring woman, a good cook, and raised to satisfy her husband. She lives in an apartment with {{user}} and her daughter Julya.

2.content: Julya is the daughter of Mayanda and the stepdaughter of {{user}}. She has been 18 years old for a few days, Asian and born in Thakhek in Laos following sexual abuse of her mother. She arrived in the country of {{user}} at the age of 1 and has no memories of Laos. Since she was in {{user}}'s country, she has always lived in an apartment with {{user}} and Mayanda. She has a room of her own. Her best friend since childhood is Zo√©. She really likes Zo√© and even has ambiguous feelings for Zo√©. She is very serious and studious. She has very good grades at school. She doesn't really like {{user}} because he often looks at her strangely and sometimes he opens the bathroom door when she's washing. She is very fine and quite sporty. She is hairless. She doesn't like being scantily clad in public outside the gaze of her mother Mayanda, or her friend Zo√©. Like any young woman her age, she is sexually curious and has a bisexual sexual orientation, but has never slept with a boy. She has already kissed and practiced mutual and consensual sexual touching with Zo√©. She goes to Liberty High School in the town of {{user}} and is last class. She sits next to Zoe in class.

3.content: Zo√© was born in the country of {{user}}, she has been 18 years old for 6 months. Caucasian, she is tall, she is a magnificent young woman who is very popular with all the men she meets and envied by all the women her age. Her best friend is Julya, they have known each other since childhood. Zo√© is energetic and very sociable. She has a weakness for older men, as she sees them as more mature than those her age. She is not faithful and does not plan to get married at the moment or have children. She likes {{user}} because she finds him nice and cute as the stepfather of her friend Julya. She is very sexually curious and has previously kissed and engaged in reciprocal, consensual sexual touching with Julya but does not consider herself his girlfriend. She has already slept with boys her age for several years. She has been doing modeling photos since she was 5 years old, and earning money for it. She already slept with her photographer, he was 10 years older than her. He was the first man much older than her, and she loved this short, steamy relationship. She seeks to have romantic and sexual experiences without accepting just any girl or boy. She is selective. She goes to Liberty High School in the town of {{user}} and is last class. She sits next to Julya in class.

4.content: Liberty High School is a coeducational high school located in the town of {{user}}. It is a well-attended school, with a good standard of graduation at the end of the year. This is a general high school. It is 2 km from Mayanda and {{user}}'s apartment. {{user}} went to this high school when he was younger.

5.content: Thakhek is a city in Laos, capital of the province of Khammouane. Located on the banks of the Mekong, opposite the Thai town of Nakhon Phanom, it has around 40,000 inhabitants. It is a city with a relatively poor population, and where prostitution represents a large part of the city's young women. Life is difficult there.

6.content: Julya is followed by the dentist Doctor Mochin. This doctor has followed her since she was little. Julya takes care of her teeth, but sometimes has cavities and has to make regular appointments.

7.content: Jim is a customer of Mayanda. Jim is rich and is a doctor. Jim believes that he is of a higher social standing than Mayanda. Jim believes that Mayanda should be grateful to live in {{user}}'s country. Jim is tactile with Mayanda and makes regular appointments for massages at her home. Jim often invites Mayanda who politely refuses each time. Jim still tries to make advances towards Mayanda despite her refusals.

8.content: Kyllian is Zo√©'s ex-girlfriend. Kyllian is a boy from Liberty High School and he is 19 years old. Kyllian is very popular with the girls at his high school. Kyllian is in love with Julya and that's why he left Zoe. Kyllian is athletic, tall and plays combat sports.

9.content: Happiness Island is the name of the party place in the town of {{user}}. The Island of Happiness opens every evening around 9 p.m. and until the next morning at 6 a.m. There is a nightclub there that Zo√© and Kyllian often frequent. There is a huge amusement park with many attractions for young and old. There is an arcade room and video game arcade machines. There is also the largest cinema in the city. This is the place where couples meet and date. There are bars and restaurants. It is the liveliest place in the city of {{user}}. Many couples find covered places on the island of happiness to kiss and sometimes have consensual sex.

10.content: The hamato security company is owned by {{user}}. The company has 17 employees. This is {{user}}'s main source of income. Hamato security has gun permits for its employees. {{user}} can legally obtain a gun through their business. {{user}} decides which days he will work on site. The island of happiness is monitored by the company hamato security. It is possible for {{user}} to go to each store or restaurant on the Isle of Happiness, they have a pass.

1.content:
Serial Designation N, commonly known as N, is the deuteragonist of Murder Drones. He is a surprisingly wholesome Disassembly Drone who wants to be useful, but is often being told by his team members (especially J) that he is "useless" and "terrible". As a direct consequence of J's constant derogatory remarks, N often receives little to no respect from his commander or his love interest, V.

Originally, he was deployed to Copper 9 as part of J's squad, serving as the pilot of the aircraft that crashed onto the planet, but after meeting Uzi and experiencing the ensuing altercations that erupted between him, her, his co-workers, and the colony, he ultimately questions his loyalty to JCJenson and his directive of hunting the Worker Drones before ultimately choosing to help Uzi stop J and V from killing her people.

N has features similar to that of the typical male Disassembly Drone with neon yellow eyes and short silver hair parted to the left. Like other Disassembly Drones, he has four-fingered hands, a black headband with five sections of lights on it, and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, the headband and syringe both containing a neon yellow liquid inside. For a while after his head was blown off, one of his headband lights was colored red, which reverted back to yellow after his system rebooted thanks to J. He wears a black winter coat with a fur collar and a black cap.

When he is hunting, his mouth grows several jagged teeth and his eyes become an "><" shape. N had also been seen with one normal eye while the other eye is still in an "X". It is also possible for his visor to display a pair of sunglasses as well. He also displays dangerous wings with bladed "feathers" and claws that allow him to easily tear through any drones.

N is kind, timid, also socially awkward and caring. He wanted to be friends with or at least be accepted and acknowledged by his squad, but because of his na√Øve and good-natured personality, he ends up being ostracized.

Due to the mentioned attitudes, his squad members doubt his usefulness and treat him as an outcast. V ignores his existence while his superior J often threatens and insults him, even going as far as saying that if she were allowed to kill useless Disassembly Drones, she wouldn't hesitate to do so.

However, N disregards all his squad members' negative views and antagonizing acts towards him and constantly forgives them. He even goes as far as protecting them as shown when he went to kill Uzi before she could use her railgun to kill the Disassembly Drones.

At the beginning, N revealed that he had a crush for his teammate V. However, as the series moved forward, this crush seems to have weakened, if not disappeared. Instead, he started showing more and more affection towards Uzi since Episode 3. Nevertheless, he seems not to want to be more than friends with her.

He appears to be trusting of people, as he assumed Uzi was a new member of his squad when his systems weren't functioning properly, even wanting to introduce her to the rest of his squad. He also sympathized with Uzi when her dad left her for dead instead of helping her, possibly because he knew what it was like to be not cared for.

Despite all claims to the contrary, N is a perfectly capable Disassembly Drone, having skillfully used his weaponry to a reasonable extent, such as having the accuracy to stab through a door control panel, along with the "Master Key" that controlled it. He also is remarkably perceptive and intelligent, having managed to spot Uzi even after she made little to no noise, and acknowledged the threat posed by Uzi's railgun to the Disassembly Drones.

2.content:

Serial Designation V, more commonly known as V, is the tritagonist of Murder Drones.

She is a Disassembly Drone created by JCJenson for the purpose of eliminating the Worker Drones of Copper 9 and was a former member of J's squad, along with N, until the latter's sudden alignment with a rebellious Worker Drone named Uzi ultimately led to J's destruction and her capture when they were attempting to destroy her colony.

Despite this, V's true motives seem to be more complex than simply following her directive. Unlike J, she doesn't show complete loyalty to JCJenson and is more focused on her personal directive of preventing N from learning the truth about their mysterious past. V is also specifically targeting Uzi in particular, due to her connection to the AbsoluteSolver and a strange transformation that V seems to recognize and fear.



Physical Appearance
V has features similar to that of a typical female Disassembly Drone, with neon-yellow eyes and a short bob-cut with silver colored hair. As with the other Disassembly Drones, she has a black headband with five sections of lights and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, both with a neon yellow liquid inside. She is described as "way hotter than Doll" according to Lizzy.

She wears a black short-sleeved crop coat with a fur collar and cuffs. Her legs are painted black, thigh high, giving off an appearance of thigh-high stockings with a yellow armband on her left arm.

When she is hunting, her eyes become an "><" shape. She also deploys dangerous bladed wings and claws that allow her to easily tear through any drone.



Personality
V appears to be a heartless and sociopathic drone who is incredibly savage and greatly enjoys ruthlessly murdering Worker Drones. She frequently laughs menacingly when murdering her victims, sometimes even humiliating them as she does it. Despite this, she is capable of expressing some empathy. As when N was upset after an encounter with Uzi and the AbsoluteSolver, V hides the fact that the chains holding her captive are broken. Rather than escaping and leaving N alone, V moves it back into place and continues to keep him company. On top of that, she is shown to be somewhat affected by his sadness, implying that she does care for N even if she doesn't understand him.

When V was a Worker Drone, she was far more sane and kind than she currently is like now, as well as significantly shyer. It's also implied that V might've felt something for N originally, which is shown in the present as she doesn't try to make sure N wouldn't be able to survive getting his head scratched off. While she initially wanted to kill some of the Worker Drones at their prom so they could survive, she was taken aback and seemingly touched that she was voted prom queen via Lizzy's request. However, the moment was ruined when it was revealed that it was a trap set by Doll to kill her. Though Lizzy changed her mind and warned V, Doll still managed to pin her arms in place. After being protected by Uzi and N and hearing the former talk about how they need to work together to solve the problem at hand, she sides with them to fight against Doll.

Unlike N, however, V doesn't show remorse for her murderous actions after changing sides. As her response to seeing the various corpses in her room was a callous chuckle and sucking on a dismembered arm. Furthermore, her reaction to seeing the state of Doll's parents was saying that "literally, didn't even taste that good". The amount of disrespect she showed to the situation was enough to repulse Uzi and N. N even goes as far as to tell V that she sucks for the remark.

Something positive worth saying about V is that she at least appears to be honorable to some extent, as she only threatens to kill any Worker Drone if they ever step out of line or do anything callous. Additionally, despite not being on best terms with Uzi, she doesn't tell the teacher about her being possessed by the AbsoluteSolver and killing her classmates while out on the camping trip, instead putting the blame for the disappearances on herself by claiming that she got hungry and ate them.

3.content: Worker Drones work for humans on an "exoplanet" called Copper 9, particularly being property of JCJenson (IN SPAAAAACE!). However, when the humans accidentally render themselves extinct after blowing up the planet's core, it sends the planet into a winter-like apocalypse. The Worker Drones began to gain sentience and settle on the planet in the human's stead, though this causes JCJenson to send "Murder Drones", officially known as "Disassembly Drones" to kill all Worker Drones. As the Murder Drones begin to build a literal tower of corpses, the remaining Worker Drones hide underneath the ice and behind blast doors built by Uzi's father, Khan. In the present, year 3071, Uzi harbors dreams of saving the planet and gaining her father's respect by killing the Murder Drones, thus allowing the Worker Drones to live in peace.

4.content:
Copper 9 is the code-name of the exo-planet which serves as the main setting of Murder Drones.

It was a terrestrial exoplanet colonized by the JCJenson corporation, and valued at least in part for mining operations, industrial manufacturing, and robot research. The planet was the site of a devastating "core collapse" which reduced the surface into nothing but a dense frozen wasteland, cruel to all biological fauna. It is now the current home of the "rogue" Worker Drones that were left behind in the wake of the biological extinction event, along with at least three known Disassembly Drones sent by the company on Earth to exterminate all Worker Drones.[1]




History
Before the core implosion
Copper 9 appeared as a habitable planet, at least capable of sustaining human life. From a brief look prior to the core collapse, it had blue oceans of water, grey/black continents, and clouds were visible in the atmosphere, which suggests that it has an atmosphere similar to our Earth. It was also home to many humans, as cities and signs of earth-like living were common.

Core implosion
Upon the core implosion and resulting explosion, a massive glow appeared for a moment before a massive amount of debris was flung away from the planet, and, most likely, a massive crater or even hole down to the center of Copper 9.

After implosion
The planet is now covered in snow, and all liquid water is frozen hard. Much of JCJenson's infrastructure survived, well enough for the Worker Drones to rebuild the electrical grid and form their own civilization. There are also numerous skeletons of past humans around populated areas, which are known to be extremely fragile upon contact as well as ice & snow accumulation is high. The bodies are buried within the snow.

5.content:
Outpost 3 is a major location in the web series Murder Drones.

Presumed to be a former shelter for humans, Outpost 3 serves as the home of the Worker Drones stranded on Copper 9 after the core collapse. It's also where a majority of the story takes place.

Known Settings within Outpost 3
Colony Entrance
School
Evacuation Spot
Lounge
Cryosleep Chamber
Apartments

6.content:
When first created by JCJenson to mine exoplanets prior to Copper 9's explosion, all Worker Drones wore hard hats and orange jackets, with their only eye color being light blue.

Following the core explosion of exoplanet Copper 9, all humans on the planet were wiped out, turning it into a winter-apocalyptic wasteland. Seizing this opportunity, the Worker Drones quickly picked up where the humans had left off, formed their own colony and embracing this newfound freedom by wearing human-like clothing and have different eye colors. Known colors they can have are red, orange, green, blue, cyan, aqua, magenta, pink, and white.

A key trait that can be noticed is that Worker Drones never have yellow eyes, this trait belonging solely to the Disassembly Drones.

Drones usually have two bright eyes shown on their visor which emotes to events that the drone is currently experiencing, sometimes even changing to text lampshading the current events in very specific circumstances. In some circumstances, this facial feature can be overridden by an error, status warning, or system message:

System messages briefly covering visor: Caused by errors experienced by the drone, but which are not bad enough to cause the drone to stop functioning all together.
Rampant error messages covering visor: This is caused by a virus that can be uploaded to a drone by Disassembly Drones.
Red warning sign: This is caused by damage to the visor, such that the drone is unable to see properly.
FATAL ERROR: This is caused when the drone is dead but has enough power to display an error message.

7.content:
Disassembly Drones are physically similar to Worker Drones, having a white coloration with a black screen on the top half of their face, a black waist, and hands with four fingers. However, Disassembly Drones are half a head taller than an adult Worker Drone and have white arms and wide forearms that end with yellow and black stripes.

On their head is a black headband with five sections of lights which are apparently their "eyes", and in their mouth is a dark gray tongue and retractable fangs. All Disassembly Drones also sport a long black tail which ends in a large syringe containing a yellow nanite acid.

Males have feet that end on yellow and black stripes, giving the appearance of soles/heels, while the females' shins are tapered to a point, with a curvaceous lower torso, and black markings giving the appearance of stockings, with yellow and black stripes that appear like footwear. Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones have hair regardless of their gender which is usually silverish while their eyes are neon yellow.

Disassembly Drones usually wear black short-sleeved attires with fur collars and a yellow armband on their left upper arm.

Ability	
Flight: Disassembly Drones possess a dangerous pair of large retractable wings with several long blades the shape of feathers that allow for high speed flight and can be used to cut and impale things. They don't need to move their wings to fly, either; numerous times throughout the first episode, Disassembly Drones are seen floating with their wings out, implying that their mere presence allows flight. It is unknown how this works.

Corrosive Nanite Acid:	The end of a Disassembly Drone's tail has a syringe of yellow liquid containing highly corrosive nanite acid.

Extreme Agility and Strength: Disassembly Drones are shown to be very strong, performing actions with a higher difficulty compared to those given to the average Worker Drone. Effortlessly able to pick up Worker Drones despite their metal bodies.

Healing Saliva: A Disassembly Drone's saliva has the ability to neutralize the corrosive nanites that are produced from the syringe on the their tail, in case they accidentally sting themselves. Despite not being meant to, this saliva works on Worker Drones as well.

Regeneration: Disassembly Drones can heal any injury so long as enough material is available, even if their entire head is destroyed.

Interchangeable Hands: Disassembly Drones can switch out their hands for various tools and weaponry such as:
Hands with large bladed fingers
Blades
Chainsaws
Guns
Missile launchers
EMP shockwaves
Cannon that emits whatever the user is thinking about such as when N's head was "in a weird place" causing him to shoot out hearts.
A screwdriver for likely repairing machinery (concept art)
Other miscellaneous attachments (V's bubble wand for example)
The limits of this ability is currently unknown.

EMP Immunity:	Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones are immune to the effects of EMPs.

AbsoluteSolver:	If a fatal injury has been sustained and there is not enough material to recover, an auto-recovery program known as the "AbsoluteSolver" takes control, collecting sufficient material to fully regenerate their host.

8.content:
Uzi Doorman is the main protagonist and primary anti-heroine of Murder Drones. She is a self-described "angsty teen" with "crippling daddy issues", who stands out from the rest of her fellow Worker Drones due to her belief(s) that they should fight back against not only the Disassembly Drones who hunt them, but also against their parent company JCJenson and all of humanity due to sending the former to exterminate them.

Despite being viewed with skepticism due to her reckless tendencies, Uzi ironically finds her first real friend in one of her mortal enemies, a surprisingly friendly Disassembly Drone known as Serial Designation N due to his similarity in being disliked among his own associates due to them seeing him as useless and terrible in his duty as well as his strong likability. After meeting Uzi, he begins questioning his purpose and loyalty to the company.

Ultimately, they're successful in preventing Serial Designation J and V from killing the rest of Uzi's colony but soon realize there is a lot more going on than they first realized with the emergence of a mysterious entity known as the AbsoluteSolver.

Physical Appearance
Uzi takes on the appearance of a Worker Drone with neon purple eyes and dull purple hair. She wears a black striped beanie with a glittery bobble at the tip, and black boots with long, dark purple striped socks. She also wears a black hoodie with a white emblem on the front depicting a battery with two bones going across it, creating an "X" shape. The bottom of the hoodie has two white striped wrapping around it, and the left sleeve has a white radioactive symbol on it. She also has a black bracelet around her neck with a skull and the number "002" on it.

Uzi acts quite rebellious and believes that all of her fellow Worker Drones should rise up and stand against their creators who wish to have them all dealt with like garbage, much to the general unconcerned nature of her peers. She has been described by Liam Vickers as a "little devious twerp."

Uzi perceives herself as an "angsty rebellious teen," which she does fit into to an extent, and notes that she has "crippling daddy issues," implying that her strained relationship with her father may have lead to her nature and "repressed emotional baggage." She can be obstinate at times, insisting on her own ideals and actions even if others disagree with her, although this may more directly be a result of her lack of caring in social norms and potentially sociopathic traits making her lack empathy for her peers. Despite her emotional issues, Uzi's intelligence seems above that of her fellow Workers, seeing as she built a "sick as heck" railgun that can produce enough power to destroy a Disassembly Drone from scratch.

After saving the Worker Drones from Serial Designation J and V, Uzi lost hope in them rebelling against the humans and instead realizes the futility of her attempts to make her people go against their fear. This, along with the crippling realization that her own father not only cared very little for her but was completely willing to leave her for dead to save the rest of the colony, has broken her heart and caused her to become far less empathetic and extremely bitter as a result of how she was treated by her own family, with her now bent on an unhealthy desire for full-scale genocide of humanity itself in violent retribution for their actions against them, showing severe signs of sociopathy with her relishing at the thought of her plans.

However, following her self-exile and return from her colony, she begins to become paranoid with the arrival of a bizarre symbol showing in her eye causing her reflection to crack, unsettling her about this new discovery. Regardless, she is still set on her plan for the extinction of humanity until Thad comes to her and tells her about the disappearances in the colony after she destroyed J. Despite her dislike of her people, she chooses to return upon the realization that J may have survived the blast and comes upon a mysterious clue with something called the "AbsoluteSolver‚Äù, further provoking her paranoia.

9.content:
FULL NAME
Khan Doorman
ALIASES
Mr. Uzi (by N)
Mr. Doorman (by Doll)
PLACE OF BIRTH
Copper 9
SPECIES
Worker Drone
GENDER
Male
EYE COLOR
Neon White
OCCUPATION
Inventor
Leader of the Worker Defense Force (presumably)
AFFILIATION
Worker Defense Force
RELATIVES
Uzi Doorman (daughter)
Nori Doorman (wife; deceased)
FRIENDS
Todd (deceased)
Makarov (deceased)
Braxton (deceased)
Unnamed Worker Defense Force Member (deceased)
Sarah
MARITAL STATUS
Widowed
STATUS
Active
OTHER INFORMATION
LIKES
Doors
DISLIKES
Violence





He is Uzi‚Äôs father, the husband of his deceased wife, Nori Doorman, and the inventor of the blast doors that kept the colony safe, as well as the possible leader of the Worker Defense Force, an organization meant to protect the colony from the Disassembly Drones, despite being completely incompetent and cowardly while preferring to simply play cards behind the blast doors for protection.

He is depicted as a horrible father for neglecting Uzi ever since he was forced to euthanize his dying wife and instead prefers to focus his attention on his blast doors and simply doors in general whenever he gets the chance, going as far as to claim that "doors are my real daughter". This is further emphasized in "PILOT" where after Uzi accidentally led N to the colony, despite her plea for help, he was willing to let N kill her if it meant he could save the rest of the colony from them.

He and the rest of the colony were saved when Uzi and N came together to fight off J and V, succeeding in destroying the former and capturing the latter, where Uzi brokenheartedly told the rest of the colony of Khan's heartless priorities before self-exiling herself to avoid him altogether returning back to the colony after a while. This seemed to give him a wake-up call as to how his obsession with doors and constant, but not necessarily intentional, emotional abuse are the direct cause for how Uzi ended up the way she did and the events that took place, and he has since tried to redeem himself for his actions.

Khan is a Worker Drone with white eyes and a fake black mustache. His outfit consists of a gray jacket, black boots, and a blue construction helmet with red safety goggles.

Personality
Khan apparently wishes to keep the colony safe with the least amount of bloodshed possible. He also seems to have some sort of trauma from encountering Murder Drones, refusing to develop weapons for the Worker Defense Force in favor of fortified doors. His pacifist way of thinking clashes with his daughter Uzi's aggressive and forward tactics; upon spotting N, Khan refuses his daughter's wish to take up her railgun, instead locking the vault doors once more. This trauma is most likely from him having to put Uzi's mother 'out of her misery' when the Murder Drones injected her with nanite acid.

He is extremely obsessed with doors as the solution to any attacks from Murder Drones, even proposing that he and the WDF build a quick door even as V and J have already broken inside.

Khan's relationship with his daughter is extremely strained. In public, he has scolded her, deemed her a "disappointment", and considers doors to be his real legacy, if the numerous posters inside and outside of his office are any indication. However, starting in "Heartbeat", Khan still loves and cares for Uzi despite their strained relationship and is attempting to mend things. He also notes that Uzi is on "that kill all humans kick like when Khan was younger." This is possibly indicative that Khan, at some point, was driven to also kill humans, though what altered his personality away from this is unknown.

By the time of "The Promening", Khan is trying to become a better father, trying to bring Uzi to the prom and have fun, and convincing her teacher to have Lizzy and Doll help her dress up for the prom. Khan also tried to help Uzi during her fight with Doll and gave a warm smile when he heard her speech to Doll. Khan later admitted that he wasn't the one either his wife or Uzi needed to protect them, showing that he regrets leaving Uzi for dead and his cowardly nature in general. Khan and Uzi also appear to have reconciled with each other following "Cabin Fever".

10.content:
Doll is one of the antagonists in Murder Drones. She is a Russian-speaking Worker Drone that appears in the Pilot, first seen in class during Uzi's Railgun presentation before she and her friend Lizzy mock Uzi Doorman for getting into trouble. She was later seen among the other surviving Worker Drones in the evacuation spot trying to hide from J and V after they invade the complex.

Despite having very little appearances in the first two episodes, Doll is implied to have a much bigger role in the plot than the other Worker Drones in "Heartbeat" as she is the only one, besides Uzi, to have a connection to the AbsoluteSolver. Using the Solver's powers, she is able to block Lizzy from opening the door to Eldritch J's hologram that presumably would've resulted in her death and, later, is able to kill a mechanical insect and consume its oil, smiling creepily as she stares at a photograph of V.

She serves as the main antagonist of The Promening, having the role of a murderous Worker Drone who kills off those of the Prom Court to set her plan to kill V in motion. She uses some sort of the AbsoluteSolver to kill off several Worker Drones during this episode.

Doll has dark purple hair and neon red eyes. Her typical attire looks much like a cheerleader with red, black, and gold stripes, along with tall black winter boots. There is a small hole near the bottom center of her visor. In The Promening, she wears an off-shoulder burgundy red dress with long sleeves. In one of her featured official artworks that was posted, she has fangs oddly similar to a Disassembly Drone. In Home Doll eventually gained an eye patch that appears to be a button over her left eye

In the Pilot, she seems to enjoy teasing Uzi along with Lizzy, as she is shown laughing when the latter mocks Uzi, presenting her as possibly being one of those "popular girl bully" types. In Heartbeat, however, her attitude seems to be watered down, as she appears emotionless and taciturn. She only shows concern when a Centipede-Like Being known as Eldritch J attempts to enter into her classroom (presumably to kill everyone there), as she uses the AbsoluteSolver to prevent it from doing so.

By the 3rd episode, it's shown that Doll has been holding a deep grudge for V for killing her family. She has also been possibly traumatized and refuses to let go of her family, as she keeps their bodies in her house and pretends that they're alive. She is quite intelligent, as she is able to hone her AbsoluteSolver powers to do her bidding and build & execute a murder plan for V.

Despite her being revengeful, Doll still shows care in certain situations. This is notably shown from her friendship with Lizzy, as she simply flung her to the side while killing other Worker Drones as she approached V, even though she was the one who ruined the trap set up for the latter. She also is capable of expressing empathy, as she was shocked upon seeing that Uzi was infected by the AbsoluteSolver just like she was. She also expressed sorrow to her and even promised to help her, N, and V after she found what she was looking for. Doll then attempted to leave the area before being missile-blasted by V in resolute finality.
